 for service management.

title: Network Data Section Manager
description:
At Nissan, we're not just building cars, we're revolutionizing mobility. We believe that every individual possesses a unique set of skills and passions that can be harnessed to drive innovation and shape the future of the automotive industry. Our global impact is fuelled by a force of over 160,000 dedicated minds, crafting and delivering innovation since 1933. For over 90 years, our core belief in doing what others don't has driven innovation and excitement for our customers, shaping Nissan into the business it is today. We are not just a company - we're a movement, pushing boundaries and embracing the spirit of "Defy Ordinary".
   

  

 We are now looking for a
 **Network Data** 
 to join our newly created RBU. In this role, you will join the Analytics & Innovation team and report to the Marketing Knowledge & Data Analytics Manager.
   

  

**How you can contribute and have an impact?**
* Ensure we get profitability data (eBM/DSPM) from networks and ensure our customer data flows for right level of customer data from dealers. Collection of network data. Interaction with DMS providers
* Responsible for the preparation, extrapolation and analysis of network and profitability + Dealer data integration
* Analyze Dealer performance and profitability (example : Market View & eBM)
* Responsible of providing data for Fall-down and Escalation process
* Provide to Franchise team / Big Group team with financial and performance reports to support candidate negotiations (D&B Risk tool and/ or eBM)
* Prepare benchmarks and support Franchise team / Big Group team to facilitate dealer eBM reviews and proposals for individual dealer improvement
* Ensure sufficient training (internal) for dealer systems (example: Market View & eBM)
* Manage systems and stake holders in connection to dealer systems (eg. Market View & eBM) and any dealer system integration projects (eg. DDI)
* Network Data purchase and update (TIV, registration, UIO data, dealer profitability etc.)
* Control budget related to the dealer data and systems
* Managing special projects and ad-hoc reporting and analysis for regional and national management


**What we look for:**
* Minimum 5 years professional experience preferably within the automotive industry, EV experience is a plus
* Experience within an international, matrix organization is highly advantageous
* Experience in Finance (financial statements) & Cost accounting
* Experience in Data management/engineering
* Higher education at Bachelors' level
* Fluency in English, other local languages are considered as an advantage
* Analytical skills
* Advanced PC skills
* Experienced MS Office user, especially in Excel
* Presentation skills
* Understanding of financial statements and experience from financial tools
* Data-driven decision-making
* Borderless and virtual mindset
* Ability to simplify
* Familiarity with data Management principles and practices
* Experience creating and documenting policies and procedures
* Ability to work with both business stakeholders and technical support teams to resolve data issues
* Ability to communicate successfully with stakeholders at all levels to understand their needs and translate those needs
* Ability to communicate with highly technical individuals about the desires, insights, and observations of the business and to ensure development and deployment of appropriate solutions


 Nissan believes the power comes from the inside, the diversity and well-being of its employees is key to success. People are our most valuable assets, and diversity and inclusion are the key to maximizing the power of each individual member of our team. Nissan is committed to be a truly diverse, equitable, and inclusive company that empowers everyone to bring their best, most authentic selves to work. Respecting each person, their opinions and value is when we can drive innovations that make a difference.
   

  

 Our future vision and ambition is "Together We Empower Mobility and Beyond" for a cleaner, safer and more inclusive world.
   

  

 Amsterdam Netherlands

title: Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

****Din profil (Skall krav)****
 Minst 4 års erfarenhet
   

  

 Erfarenhet av javautveckling (minst 5 år)
   

  

 Erfarenhet av utveckling i Linux-miljö (minst 3 år)
   

  

 Erfarenhet av Quarkus, Springboot eller liknande (minst 3 år)
   

  

 Erfarenhet av teambaserad utveckling enligt agila principer (minst 3 år)
   

  

 Goda kunskaper i git, maven och liknande moderna verktyg som gradle
   

  

 Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, i både tal och skrift
   

  

****Meriterande****
* Minst 1 års grundläggande kunskaper i app- eller frontendprogrammering
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av att bygga, drifta och övervaka system i containerbaserade miljöer som kubernetes, openshift eller liknande
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av utveckling inom PKI, certifikathantering, kryptografiska säkerhetsfunktioner, användning av HSM
* Minst 1 års erfarenhet av SAML2, OpenID-familjen eller OAuth 2.0
* Minst 1 års kunskaper om SQL-databaser, NoSQL-databaser och cachelösningar
* Erfarenhet av Kafka eller liknande asynkrona meddelandeköer
* Erfarenhet av att utveckla öppen källkod


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 29-04-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Power BI-konsult / Data analytiker
description:
Nu söker vi efter fler skickliga Power BI-konsulter / Data analytiker till vårt växande team i Greenstep Sverige! Är du en fena på Power BI och vill hjälpa företag fatta bättre beslut med hjälp av data? Då kanske du är den vi söker!
   

  

 Vi söker en expert med minst 2 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med Power BI-projekt och framför allt har en vilja och passion för att utvecklas inom analysprojekt i en konsultroll. Du kommer att arbeta med fantastiska kundföretag, från startups till större börsnoterade företag, och ha hjälp av vårt kunniga BI-team. Du kommer också att vara med och utveckla vår BI SaaS-tjänst BI Book, som redan har hundratals kunder i flera länder. Vi är en växande arbetsgemenskap där nya idéer snabbt tas vidare och varje Greenstep-anställd får utvecklas professionellt!
   

  

 Vad vi önskar av en framtida teammedlem
   

  

 Du är utvecklingsbenägen, målinriktad och trivs i kundgränssnittet som expert. God förståelse för ekonomi hjälper dig att förstå kundföretagens rapporteringsbehov och förstå projektens betydelse för företagsframgång. Du är noggrann och uppmärksam på detaljer i arbetet, men samtidigt förstår du också större helheter. Vi önskar att du har en självgående arbetsmetod och mod att prova nya lösningar utanför boxen. Dessutom kräver kundarbetet goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska!
   

  

 Vem söker vi?
   

  

* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av Power BI-projekt, projektarbete, konsultation och teknisk problemlösning.
* Erfarenhet av Power BI-rapporteringsverktyg. DAX och M är bekanta språk för dig, och du har en vilja att utvecklas till en toppexpert inom Power BI genom att använda de senaste verktygen och funktionerna.
* Förståelse för datawarehousing och dataarkitektur. Vi ser SQL-, Python- och R-kunskaper som en fördel.
* Kunskap om affärsrapportering. Du kan diskutera rapportinnehåll med både ekonomi- och teknisk chef och förstår affärsbehoven.
* Relevant utbildning för uppgiften, t.ex. i analys, redovisning, finans eller IT/data inriktad civilekonom- eller civilingenjörsexamen.


**Vad erbjuder vi dig?**
* Professionell, inkluderande och öppen företagskultur, där vi arbetar i team och hjälper varandra att tillsammans nå våra mål!
* En konkurrenskraftig lön och vinstdelningsprogrammet "Tillsammans", där 10% av den årliga vinsten delas till medarbetarna
* Moderna och centralt belägna trivsamma kontor i Stockholm, Norrköping, Umeå, Sundsvall och Göteborg
* Kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling i arbetet och utbildningar som stöttar kompetensutvecklingen
* Attraktivt tjänstepensions- och försäkringspaket, friskvårdsbidrag samt olika motions och personalevenemang


 Varför Greenstep?
   

  

 Greenstep är ett familjeföretag som grundades 2010 i Finland. Idag är vi över 700 medarbetare och specialister inom redovisning, lön, HR, skatt- och affärsjuridik, CFO, hållbarhetstjänster, ERP-system och automation. Varje greenstepare är viktig för oss och vi vill utöver intressanta arbetsuppgifter erbjuda goda anställningsförhållanden för alla. Vi utför vårt specialistarbete utgående från vår gemensamma värdegrund, vars kärna är en vilja att glädja kunden genom kvalité och anpassat enligt kundernas behov. Greenstep har i dagsläget kontor i Finland, Sverige, Åland, Estland och Norge, vilket ger en unik möjlighet till internationella kontakter och karriärmöjligheter. I övriga länder betjänar Greenstep sina kunder genom MSI Global Alliance.
   

  

**Istället för föråldrade hierarkier fokuserar vi på teamtänk och självledarskap i en arbetsgemenskap där ingen blir lämnad ensam. Hos oss blir du en del av ett team där expertis, hållbarhet och en genuin vilja att hjälpa och stötta varandra är en självklar del av vardagen.** 
 💚
   

  

**Ta nästa steg i din karriär: Greenstep!**
 Skicka gärna din ansökan snarast men senast
 **20** 
**april 2025.**
 Vi kan komma att begära utdrag ur belastningsregistret samt skuldfrihetsintyg som inhämtas från Kronofogdemyndigheten för personer som rekryteras till oss.

title: Content Creator
description:
*At Desenio Group, a Swedish e-commerce success story, we are passionate about interior decor and design! Our business idea is simple: on-trend, attractive wall decor should be available to everyone. Since our inception, we’ve experienced steady growth and can now boast web shops available in more than 35 countries, with new markets opening continuously. At Desenio and Poster Store, you’ll find a wide selection of posters and mounting solutions, such as poster hangers and clips - often inspired by Scandinavian style.*
 We are now looking for a Content Creator to join our team. As a Content Creator, you will produce digital content for our two brands, Desenio and Poster Store. You will be part of a creative and talented team, producing engaging, high-quality content across various platforms, ensuring our contents resonates with our brands. You will report to Head of Brand Studio.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Produce content across our website and channels, incl. social media and newsletters
* Edit and produce professional-quality videos and content, ensuring they align with brand standards and messaging.
* Utilize AI tools to enhance content creation, including automation of tasks, improving efficiency, and generating creative ideas.
* Produce ads in alignment with our Commercial team
* Support other departments and regions with design requests


**Who We Are Looking Or**
* Education within content creation
* Proven experience in content creation and video editing, 2-3 years experience
* Great knowledge in Adobe Creative Suite, After effects, Premiere Pro
* Excellent knowledge in English, both spoken and written
* Understanding of current trends and a genuine interest in interior design


 IT’S A PLUS IF YOU HAVE
   

  

* Experience using AI tools for content generation, editing, or automation
* Experience in Storyteq
* Experience working in an e-commerce


 AS A PERSON
   

  

 You are a team player with great organizational skills. You are ambitious, self-driven and always tries to find more efficient ways of working. You thrive in a fast-paced environment and to work with multiple projects.
   

  

 PRACTICAL DETAILS
   

  

 Start date: As soon as possible
   

  

 Extent: This is a full-time position, with an initial probation period of 6 months.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm, Södermalm.
   

  

 Send your application in English by answering the application form as well as attaching your CV and cover letter. Note! We do not accept applications through email.
   

  

**About Desenio Group**
 Desenio Group is a fast-growing design and e-commerce group with a simple business idea and purpose: making on-trend, affordable and attractive wall art available to everyone. Headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, we are Europe’s leading online store for art prints and frames, and we ship to more than 35 countries worldwide. Desenio Group’s bonds are listed on Frankfurt Stock Exchange Open Market Quotation Board. For more information, please visit deseniogroup.com

title: Cloud Lead Data Architect
description:
**AddanEx JOB POSTING:**




**Title:** 
 Cloud Lead Data Architect
 




**Location:** 
 Solna, Stockholm (Onsite 3 days per week)
 



**Type:** 
 Permanent
 



**Start Date** 
 : Between Mid-August and 1st October
 



**Utilisation:** 
 40 Hours per week
 



**Languages:** 
 English (Swedish is a Bonus)
 



**Salary Range:** 
 65-75.000 SEK/Month
 **(Open to negotiation for the right candidate)** 




**Benefits:** 
 Collective agreement ("kollektivavtal") that includes a good pension solution, insurance, a wellness allowance, flexibility in terms of working hours (no clocking in and out), and a nice office in Solna.
 



  





**About the Job:**




 We are seeking an experienced Cloud Lead Data Architect to oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of our cloud-based data solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding and practical experience with cloud technologies, particularly Microsoft Azure. A solid background in data warehouse and data lake architecture, modelling, integration, and governance is essential. In this role, you will lead the development of scalable, future-proof data solutions that align with our business objectives.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:**



* **Lead and Participate:** 
 Actively engage in and lead the architecture and design of the cloud-based data and analytics solutions
* **Data Modelling:** 
 Design, develop, and maintain conceptual, logical, and physical data models, ensuring they meet business requirements, adhere to best practices, and align with industry standards and data governance policies
* **Data Integration:** 
 Define data integration strategies and oversee the integration of data from various cloud and on-premises sources, ensuring data accuracy, consistency, and quality
* **Best Practices and Standards:** 
 Establish and enforce data architecture best practices, standards, and guidelines to ensure data integrity and security
* **Roadmap Development:** 
 Develop comprehensive data architecture roadmaps and identify opportunities for data optimization and enhancement
* **Collaboration:** 
 Work closely with IT, business stakeholders, and other teams to understand data needs and deliver analytics solutions
* **Technology Trends:** 
 Stay updated with emerging trends and technologies in data management, analytics, and cloud computing. Evaluate and recommend new technologies and tools that can enhance the organization's data capabilities



  





  





**Job Summary / Key Skills**



* Have many years of solid hands-on experience as a data engineer and data architect
* Proven track record in data architecture, design, and implementation of a common analytics platform
* Proficiency with big data technologies such as Databricks and cloud storage solutions
* Expertise in cloud platforms (preferably Azure), data modelling, data transformation processes, and data integration techniques
* Strong knowledge of dbt for data transformation and modelling
* Extensive experience with data warehouse and data lake architecture
* In-depth experience with Microsoft Azure Cloud Platform and services, including Data Lake, Azure SQL Database, Data Factory, and Power BI
* Knowledge of data governance frameworks, data quality management, and data security
* Experience with Data & Analytics solutions in an international context involving a diverse business application landscape, preferably within manufacturing
* Possess strong communication skills to effectively interact with stakeholders and manage expectations
* Be interested in training and mentoring colleagues to develop effective and efficient data solutions
* Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field

title: Sales Excellence Lead
description:
The Sales Excellence Lead is a unique opportunity to engage with, and influence, senior decision-makers across our sales organisation, and you play an integral part in our ability to deliver effectively and efficiently the revenue we commit to as a region.
   

  

 You will be fundamental to how our sales teams align to our internal methodology and practices, as you will be responsible for providing coaching and guidance while nurturing relationships across the region and strive for excellence across our sales motions. It’s your ability to help build consistent sales discipline and governance, and gather insights across multiple segments and roles, that will enable you to be an influential factor in our business’ success.
   

  

 Embrace this challenge and enhance your management capability and commercial acumen, whilst being a trusted advisor to the country leadership team.
   

  

 Microsoft’s mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Activate sponsorship within segment leaders for the Account/Portfolio Partner Business Plan.
* Define and drive a predictable rhythm of connection (ROC) in collaboration with peers and leadership.
* Guide sales teams and leadership on sales motions and strategies for opportunity management.
* Develop segment strategy for segmentation, territory planning, and quota setting.
* Coach and build relationships with sales leaders to execute key priorities.
* Drive awareness and clarity of Corporate or TimeZone programs.
* Lead optimization and improvement in sales team processes and capabilities.
* Identify trends on sales challenges or blockers.
* Lead innovations in analytics on key revenue drivers.
* Drive sales process discipline and adherence to standards in collaboration with sales leaders.
* Support segment leader capacity as a senior leader. Represents the segment as an internal advocate and an extension of the segment leadership.


**Qualifications**
 With an ability to communicate with executive level stakeholders and build relationships across a global organisation, you will be well positioned for success in this role. Some of the other knowledge and skills you will be able to demonstrate include:
   

  

* Experience in a sales or account management role
* A history working for largescale, matrix structured enterprise organisations
* Demonstrable experience with data analysis and interpreting sales metrics to drive business outcomes or inform business decisions.
* Experience of managing relationships with senior level stakeholders
* A background coaching and guiding sales teams and managers
* Fluency in English, Swedish- preffered.


 Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

title: Operational Purchaser IS/IT
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*Saab is a place where teamwork makes things fly. Literally. Join us and experience our supportive and friendly workplace.*
 Your role
   

  

 We are looking for a business-driven Operational Purchaser to join our team within IS/IT at Group Procurement, supporting Saab Business Areas within Indirect material & services. You will be responsible for operational and tactical tasks and collaborate in a wide network within Saab and its Suppliers creating stronger business together.
   

  

 You will be responsible for executing purchasing requests within a various range of IT categories such as Hardware, Software, IT Services as well as other IT categories. You will facilitate and engage in dialogue with internal stakeholders as well as the external supply base, to ensure terms are understood, accepted and implemented.
   

  

**The main tasks are:**
* Conduct purchase orders and enable efficient digital P2P solutions.
* Ensure correct supplier onboarding and setups for supplier punch outs and catalogues.
* Ensure the system content regarding products, services, information and that prices and delivery terms (Terms and conditions) are updated correctly.
* Assist and work with reports and data analysis as needed.
* Collaborate and communicate with Strategic Purchasers in the IS/IT team.
* Collaborate and communicate within cross functional teams throughout the Saab organisation.
* Analyse supplier market and Saab demand.
* Propose improvements in order to work more efficiently.


 Your profile
   

  

 We are looking for a highly motivated and results-oriented individual with a strong commitment to driving business success. You possess excellent collaboration and communication skills, enabling you to build strong relationships with both internal and external stakeholders. Your ability to communicate and collaborate effectively will be crucial in ensuring smooth procurement processes and successful outcomes.
   

  

**Required skills:**
* High school diploma or a Higher Vocational Education qualification in Procurement (Kvalificerad Yrkesutbildning), or equivalent professional experience. An academic degree is considered an advantage.
* Proven experience in procurement or sourcing is required. Experience specifically in IT, software, hardware and IT related services is preferred.
* Demonstrates both an interest in and an overall understanding of IT.
* Interest in continuous improvements and digitalisation.
* Excellent Swedish and English skills, verbal and written.


*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here
   

  

*Kindly observe that this is an ongoing recruitment process and that the position might be filled before the closing date of the advertisement.*

title: Senior Solution Delivery Lead within eHealth
description:
Cambio is one of the Nordics' leading suppliers in e-health with a comprehensive offering for the entire health and care chain. Our e-health solutions support healthcare professionals in their daily work and offer patients safer and more easily accessible care. We are proud to be an important part of Swedish health and social care. We are growing continuously and now have about 1100 employees in several countries.
   

  

**The position**
 Our
 **Customer Delivery Division** 
 ensures that customer commitments turn into reality – from signed contracts to successful delivery. We are responsible for service delivery and consulting services, all aimed at creating real value for the healthcare sector.
   

  

 As a Senior Solution Delivery Lead at Cambio, you will play a strategic role in ensuring we fulfill our contractual commitments while maintaining compliance and enhancing customer satisfaction.
   

  

 As part of our Customer Delivery Team, you will drive overall service strategy, ensuring the seamless management of services across multiple customers and markets while optimizing efficiency and impact. A crucial aspect of the position is facilitating communication between technical experts and business stakeholders to ensure alignment and clarify delivery capabilities, including security, infrastructure, and architecture. You will also participate in negotiations to secure viable solutions and ensure proper product integration within the healthcare IT ecosystem.
   

  

 At Cambio, we encourage taking initiatives that contribute to the development of the company and ourselves. For us, it is important that you should have the opportunity to grow, both as a person and as an employee. Our culture is described through the words “Trust”, “Care” and “Together” which permeate everything we do.
   

  

**About You**
 You have strong communication and collaboration skills, effectively engaging with technical teams and management. Business acumen and experience handling negotiations at an executive level, including strategic contract discussions, are essential. You thrive in an international environment and work strategically at the intersection of business and technology, focusing on healthcare IT solutions.
   

  

**Requirements** 
  

  

* Solid understanding of IT Architecture in healthcare
* Background in business solutions within eHealth
* Customer-focused mindset, building strong relationships
* Fluency in Swedish and English, written and spoken
* University degree in Business, IT, Healthcare, or related field


**Place of employment** 
 : Stockholm
   

  

 At Cambio we value a healthy work-life balance, and to encourage that we apply a hybrid working-model. Together with your team you decide which days you work at the office. On the remaining days you can work remotely from home, but you are always more than welcome to work at the office too.
   

  

**Scope** 
 : Full time
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Permanent employment, 6 months trial period
   

  

**Other:** 
 We screen the applications and hold interviews continuously so please send your application as soon as possible via the link.
   

  

 We encourage and eagerly welcome all applications, but we will only consider candidates who are located and have the legal right to work in Sweden
 **.** 
 We will ask for verification during the process.
   

  

**We look forward to receiving your application!**
 Read more about us
 **here!**
 Are you interested in Cambio but you don’t feel that this position is the perfect match? Check out our other open positions at the career site
 **here!**
 Cambio Healthcare Systems is Sweden’s leading suppliers of healthcare information systems and a growing player in the European market with just over 100,000 users across general and university hospitals, specialist units and outpatient units. Through the use of our integrated solutions, our customers provide services to 4 million patients.

title: Communications Strategist
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
Are you passionate about shaping powerful communication strategies that connect with audiences and drive business success? Do you have a proven track record in developing and executing successful marketing communication campaigns and the innovation to craft impactful communication plans that align with organizational goals and values? If so, we’re looking for you to join Saab's business area Surveillance as a Communications Strategist.
   

  

 Your Role
   

  

 As a Communications Strategist, you will play a critical role in developing, executing, and optimizing communication strategies that support our overall mission. You will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure messaging is consistent, engaging, and aligned with our brand vision. From internal communications to external campaigns, your expertise will help elevate our voice and strengthen our presence in the marketplace.
   

  

 This includes:
   

  

* Develop and implement comprehensive communication strategies that align with business objectives, brand values, and audience needs
* Collaborate with senior leadership and various teams to understand business goals and craft communication plans that support them
* Create clear and impactful messaging for both internal and external audiences
* Advise on content creation across multiple platforms (web, social media, press, events, etc.)
* Analyze communication efforts, measure effectiveness, and continuously adjust strategies based on data and feedback
* Stay up to date on industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices to maintain cutting-edge strategies


 Your profile
   

  

 Do you have a proven track record as a Communications Strategist, Communications or Public Affairs Manager, or in a similar role?
   

  

 Are you a strategic thinker with the ability to transform complex ideas into clear, impactful messages and communication plans?
   

  

 Do you excel at writing, editing, and storytelling, with a talent for crafting compelling narratives in both Swedish and English?
   

  

 Can you collaborate seamlessly with diverse teams and build strong relationships across departments?
   

  

 Do you have expertise in both traditional and digital communication platforms?
   

  

 Are you driven by data, with the ability to use metrics to evaluate and enhance communication strategies?
   

  

 If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. A Bachelor's degree in Communications, Marketing, Public Relations, or a related field (or equivalent experience) is a plus. Additionally, previous experience working on similar tasks in the defence industry or a related business sector is valued.
   

  

*This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.*
 What you will be a part off
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here.
   

  

 If you are interested in what benefits you can take part of as an employee at Saab in Sweden, you can read more about them here.

title: Strategic Account Executive (SaaS)
description:
**Build your future with Sovos.**
 If you're seeking a career where innovation meets impact, you've come to the right place. As a global leader, Sovos is transforming tax compliance from a business requirement to a force for growth while revolutionising how businesses navigate the ever-changing regulatory landscape.
   

  

 At Sovos, we're dedicated to more than just solving compliance challenges – we're committed to making a positive and lasting difference in everything we do. Our teams operate on the modern edge of digital technology, working not only to solve complex business challenges but also to enrich our personal, professional, and local communities.
   

  

 Our purpose-built systems provide the tools you need to thrive in a world where governments demand increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control over business processes. Excited about the possibilities? So are we!
   

  

 Don’t worry if you don't check all the boxes – apply anyway! We're focused on hiring the right people, not just the "right" resume. It's not about what you've done elsewhere; it's all about what you're capable of doing here.
   

  

**The Work You'll Do**
 Sovos is purpose built for modern regulatory environments – an evolving, complex landscape in which global authorities are requiring increased visibility, faster reporting and greater control of business processes, in many cases at the transaction level.
   

  

 Governments around the globe have embraced digitization to speed revenue collection, reduce fraud and close tax gaps. This is the catalyst for companies to move towards centralized compliance systems that can quickly scale to meet the demands of new and expanding mandates. Why do you care about this? Because compliance is not a nice to have, its increasingly becoming a MUST have. And Sovos offers industry's first and ONLY solution that unifies tax and regulatory reporting software in one platform. And you are the one selling it.
   

  

 The Strategic Account Executive will have the opportunity to work with a truly global team to provide a technology solution for critical needs and problems that our global customers and new prospects face. This role will directly manage the selling of the Sovos Tax Compliance Platform for assigned prospects and accounts. Our solutions help clients become and stay compliant around the world!
   

  

**More Specifically You Will**
* Generate new business opportunities for global strategic accounts (F100) while effectively managing internal enablement resources and working full sales cycle opportunities from initial contact, to close and up-sell/cross-sell
* Develop and execute an account-based commercial strategy to increase sales opportunities within existing key customers
* Deliver profitable new business revenue in order to meet and exceed revenue targets and relevant quotas
* Create and nurture executive and C-Suite relationships with existing clients and prospects
* Build a year-over-year record of consistent performance and accountability using MEDDPICC for qualification and managing complex and technical sales into large global enterprises
* Acquire and maintain in-depth knowledge of the tax compliance industry and the emerging competitive landscape
* Provide timely and accurate sales forecasts and reports to inform management’s strategic decision-making


**What We Need From You**
* Successful history of proven success selling SaaS-based platforms to large multi-national organizations through complex sales cycles, including selling different product lines to different business units
* Proven targeting, prospecting, and closing skills while achieving or exceeding revenue quotas for large multi country accounts
* Ability to present and speak knowledgably to the C-Suite level
* Employs a highly analytical approach to defining client outcomes and articulating value
* Ability to use facts and data to tell a value based story that leads to sales
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills; paying attention to details
* Moderate (less than 50%) travel required; both domestic and international


**What Does Sovos Offer You?**
 The tools to enhance your life - because we want you to enjoy your life outside of work and inside!
   

  

* Flexible Time-Off
* Uncapped Commission Plans
* Bi-Weekly Meeting Free Days
* Mentoring Programs
* Globally recognized Training and Development programs


 Sovos is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an environment that celebrates diversity and where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and employees. We do not discriminate against race, color, religions, national origin, age, sex, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic provided by law. At Sovos, all employees are encouraged to bring their whole selves to work.
   

  

**Company Background**
 Sovos is a global provider of tax, compliance and trust solutions and services that enable businesses to navigate an increasingly regulated world with true confidence. Purpose-built for always-on compliance capabilities, our scalable IT-driven solutions meet the demands of an evolving and complex global regulatory landscape. Sovos’ cloud-based software platform provides an unparalleled level of integration with business applications and government compliance processes.
   

  

 More than 100,000 customers in 100+ countries – including half the Fortune 500 – trust Sovos for their compliance needs. Sovos annually processes more than three billion transactions across 19,000 global tax jurisdictions. Bolstered by a robust partner program more than 400 strong, Sovos brings to bear an unrivaled global network for companies across industries and geographies. Founded in 1979, Sovos has operations across the Americas and Europe, and is owned by Hg and TA Associates. For more information visit http://www.sovos.com and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

title: Business Analyst | Jefferson Wells | Stockholm
description:
**Ort:** 
 Stockholm
 



**Start:** 
 Maj 2025
 



**Uppdragslängd:** 
 1 år konsultuppdrag
 



  





**Om jobbet som Business Analyst** 




 Som Business Analyst hos Jefferson Wells kommer du att spela en nyckelroll i vår kunds Management Control-team. Uppdraget innebär att arbeta nära ledningen för att ta fram affärskritiska insikter, stötta i planering och budgetering samt driva analysarbete kopplat till lönsamhet och kostnadsstrukturer.
 



 I rollen får du kombinera datadriven analys med strategiskt tänkande och arbeta med allt från ekonomisk rapportering till simuleringar och beslutsstöd. Du är också delaktig i att automatisera rapporteringsprocesser och effektivisera interna arbetssätt. Uppdraget är placerat i en internationell kontext, vilket gör att du behöver trivas i en mångkulturell och dynamisk arbetsmiljö.
 



  





**Vanligt förekommande arbetsuppgifter:** 



* Leverera insikter via dataanalys och visualisering till ledningsgruppen
* Ansvara för och utveckla interna rapporteringsprocesser (veckovis, månadsvis, kvartalsvis och årsvis)
* Bidra i planering och uppföljning av overheadkostnader på olika nivåer
* Utföra lönsamhetsanalyser och simuleringar i affärscase
* Stödja ledningsgruppen med ad hoc-analyser och rapporter
* Delta i affärsplanering samt analysera månadsbokslut och prognoser



  





**Den vi söker** 




 Vi söker dig som har ett analytiskt sinne, brinner för affärsutveckling och trivs i en roll där du får ta initiativ och påverka. Du har en akademisk bakgrund inom ekonomi eller finans, några års erfarenhet av liknande roller i internationell miljö och är van att hantera komplex data i Excel. Du är nyfiken, strukturerad och har lätt för att samarbeta med olika delar av organisationen.
 



  





**Vi ser gärna att du uppfyller följande:** 



* Akademisk examen inom ekonomi, finans eller likvärdigt område
* Minst 2 års erfarenhet av arbete som Business Analyst eller Financial Analyst
* Mycket goda kunskaper i MS Office, särskilt Excel
* Flytande kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift
* Stark analytisk och strategisk förmåga
* Förmåga att arbeta både självständigt och i team
* Flexibel, strukturerad och lösningsorienterad
* Van vid att arbeta i internationella och multikulturella miljöer



  





**Om Jefferson Wells:** 




 Jefferson Wells är ett konsult- och rekryteringsbolag specialiserat kompetensförsörjning av chefer och specialister. Jefferson Wells unika expertis och branscherfarenhet gör att vi kan få verksamheter att växa och erbjuda en långsiktig karriärutveckling för våra kandidater. Jefferson Wells finns på ett 50-tal orter i Sverige och i mer än 50 länder världen över och är en del av ManpowerGroup. Med vårt omfattande nätverk kan vi erbjuda mängder av spännande lediga jobb.
 



  





**Hur du ansöker:** 




 För att söka tjänsten klickar du på "Ansök nu" och skapar ett konto hos oss. Notera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via mail. Vi arbetar med löpande urval och ser fram emot din ansökan snarast.
 



  





**Vänligen notera! Skicka in ditt CV på engelska - det är ett krav för att vi ska kunna gå vidare med din ansökan.**

title: Head of Network Functions and Security
company_industry: Telecommunications and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
**Head of** 
**Network Functions and Security**
 I am Darius Liubinas, leading the Core Services team in IT Infrastructure & Data at Telia IT. We are looking for a manager
 **to drive the Network Functions and Security unit** 
 .
   

  

 The unit manages critical platforms, services, and architecture within IT Infrastructure network services, including B2B services. It is essential to deliver RUN/GROW/TRANSFORM activities diligently and timely, requiring thought leadership and refined processes. The unit delivers IT Infrastructure solutions to Telia stakeholders, requiring strong communication skills and business understanding. We aim to improve time to market through self-service, automation, and process optimization, matching the ambitions of the biggest hyperscale’s.
   

  

**As a** 
**Head of Network Functions and Security you will…**
 …
 **lead a team of senior experts** 
 and be
 **responsible for key results (OKRs)** 
 ,
 **KPIs** 
 , and
 **performance metrics** 
 to improve and enhance the unit. You will shape a high-performing team, improving our digital journey to provide simplified, standardized, and scalable products and services.
   

  

 You will create a collaborative, target-oriented team that strives for better results and provides the best stakeholder experience. Additionally, you will partner with country CIOs and peers in IT and NSD.
   

  

 The objectives are to
 **align with the strategic priorities** 
 and goals of the organization and its stakeholders, ensuring value delivery by meeting customer and stakeholder expectations for both standard and non-standard core services. This involves close
 **cooperation with the business** 
 to identify and understand requirements, translating them into actionable developments. Additionally, the role includes negotiating, agreeing upon, and
 **maintaining SLAs** 
 ,
 **OLAs** 
 , and underpinning contracts with the business and third-party support organizations.
   

  

 A key focus is on
 **developing** 
 and
 **enhancing** 
 the
 **self-service delivery** 
 experience while optimizing the use of resources and assets through existing and emerging technologies. Ensuring the security, reliability, and resilience of platforms, integrations, and services is crucial, following best practices and industry standards. Another important aspect is driving the consolidation of tools across the Telia company to enhance efficiency and support future evolution in this area.
   

  

**Vendor management** 
 is a critical responsibility, ensuring alignment with the vendor and sourcing strategy. Moreover, the role requires accountability for the
 **lifecycle management (LCM)** 
 of applications and services in scope, securing the sunset of legacy applications, and guiding the evolution of target systems in strong collaboration with the architecture team, business stakeholders, and system vendors. Lastly, it involves managing the competence team in accordance with long-term plans to ensure the development and sustainability of expertise within the organization.
   

  

**Who We’re Looking For**
 Your personality is characterized by
 **self-motivation** 
 and
 **strong leadership** 
 , making you a proactive and confident decision-maker. As a team player, you thrive in collaborative environments, while also being outspoken and resilient in driving sustainable solutions and making informed decisions.
   

  

 Your skills and experience include over
 **five years of leadership experience** 
 , with a background in similar roles within larger IT organizations, preferably within a Communication Service Provider. You have experience working in a multi-country operating organizational structure and possess deep insights and understanding of relevant domains, including IT infrastructure, network components such as routing and firewalls, large-scale IT operations, and DevOps ways of working.
   

  

 Additionally, you have
 **expertise in IT service delivery** 
 , including the orchestration of Agile Release Trains (ART). You have a proven track record of consistently delivering key performance indicators (KPIs) that align with industry-leading practices. Furthermore, your communication skills are excellent, both in written and spoken English, with proficiency in a Nordic or Baltic language being an advantage.
   

  

**We are more than a workplace**
 Join our inclusive team and collaborate with over 15,000 talented colleagues from around the globe. Recognized as a Climate Leader in the Nordics and Baltics, we're passionate about creating great products and delivering extraordinary customer experiences while always prioritizing sustainability. We believe our people are our most valuable asset, ensuring everyone feels welcome and valued. When you join us, you'll receive a comprehensive benefits package tailored to your local market, opportunities for remote work, and more. You'll also have the chance to earn a bonus based on your performance and Telia's results. If you want to make a real impact, this is the place where you belong.
   

  

**Ready to make better happen?**
 If you fancy joining our team, don’t hesitate to apply! If you want to know more about the job, you are welcome to contact me at +46 72 5253025.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application and to making sure that your personal data is kept safely, we kindly ask you to apply through our recruitment system. We are not able to handle resumes via e-mail or equivalent. Selection will take place on an ongoing basis and this position might be filled before the application deadline. Application deadline is 2025-04-16
   

  

 During the process, required background controls will be performed.
   

  

**Join us and let’s make better happen – together!**

title: Senior Manager Consultant
description:
**Who We Are**
 At Kyndryl, we design, build, manage and modernize the mission-critical technology systems that the world depends on every day. So why work at Kyndryl? We are always moving forward – always pushing ourselves to go further in our efforts to build a more equitable, inclusive world for our employees, our customers and our communities.
   

  

**The Role**
 Do you have a passion for driving meaningful change through technology? Are you a master of IT strategy and eager to make an impact on our customers? We're seeking a talented IT Strategy Consultant to join our team for multi-disciplinary, complex consulting engagements.
   

  

 As an IT Strategy Consultant at Kyndryl, you'll be responsible for delivering value to customers and Kyndryl by applying deep domain, technology, and industry expertise, consulting techniques, and cognitive approaches to analyze issues and create innovative solutions. You'll establish milestones, quality targets, and manage the work of others while possessing strong communication skills to articulate the impact and business benefits of your solutions and manage stakeholder expectations.
   

  

 In this role, you will use your experience and knowledge in guiding customers in their adoption of both major cloud and non-cloud technologies, including virtualization and containers. You will advise customers on technology options and help them make strategic choices and decisions. Additionally, you will have experience capturing and prioritizing complex requirements and resolving conflicting requirements. But that's not all – our IT Strategy Consultants have seen how organizations benefit from change and most importantly, know how to plan for it – giving our partners and customers the confidence to make a convincing case for it.
   

  

 As a trusted and experienced Consultant, you will be responsible for a vast number of essential technical components such as analyzing the customer's current state, defining IT Strategy including key outcomes, designing conceptual solutions, planning and executing design and implementation work (with support from technical specialists), and accounting for time, cost, and quality targets. You will also develop IP and own specific assets, tools, and white papers articulating point of views in a specific domain, assemble and lead a team of consultants and architects, and facilitate and capture lessons learned from engagements to update methodologies and assets.
   

  

 Lastly, as a transformational catalyst, you'll spearhead comprehensive modernization programs encompassing people, culture, process, and technology, revolutionizing organizations from within. Join us at Kyndryl and redefine the very essence of IT strategy consultancy.
   

  

 Your Future at Kyndryl
   

  

 As an IT Strategy Consultant at Kyndryl you will join the Kyndryl Consultant Profession, working with other Kyndryl Consultants, Architects, Project Managers, and cross-functional Technical Subject Matter Experts. Whether you want to lead multi-disciplined teams as a Senior Strategy Consultant or delve into transforming Fortune 500 companies as a Strategy and Transformation Consultant – you’ll have access to unlimited opportunities with Kyndryl.
   

  

**Who You Are**
 You’re good at what you do and possess the required experience to prove it. However, equally as important – you have a growth mindset; keen to drive your own personal and professional development. You are customer-focused – someone who prioritizes customer success in their work. And finally, you’re open and borderless – naturally inclusive in how you work with others.
   

  

**Required Skills And Experience**
* Consulting experience with an IT professional service “big 4” firm or similar background focused on IT strategy enablement
* Knowledge of major cloud technologies including virtualization, containers, networking etc. on different cloud platforms
* Subject matter expertise in at least three domains (e.g., cloud computing, IT strategy, infrastructure, IT operations, applications, enterprise architecture, solution architecture, automation, data management, AI/ML, IoT and cloud governance models) to advise on industry-leading solutions
* Data modeling and analytical experience using common tools (e.g., Excel, Tableau)
* Issue-based analysis determined and structured data to collect, and produced structured conclusions, recommendations, and roadmaps
* Knowledge of IT Operating Model and Process Frameworks
* Awareness of broad competencies and depth in specific competency areas (IT strategy, enterprise architecture, solution architecture, process reengineering, automation)
* Ability to lead/facilitate workshops and interviews, great presentation skills
* Understanding of DevSecOps, Agile, Scrum construct to identify inefficiencies through readiness assessments and development of strategies and approaches to optimize the implementation of IT or cloud resources and capabilities


**Preferred Skills And Experience**
* Experience in the areas of IT and/or cloud technology architecture, service management and/or resiliency
* ITSM and ITIL or COBIT certification
* Business case skills, ROI, and TCO analysis to validate IT strategy
* Experience leading workshops and interviews for discovery and assessment engagements


**Being You**
 Diversity is a whole lot more than what we look like or where we come from, it’s how we think and who we are. We welcome people of all cultures, backgrounds, and experiences. But we’re not doing it single-handily: Our Kyndryl Inclusion Networks are only one of many ways we create a workplace where all Kyndryls can find and provide support and advice. This dedication to welcoming everyone into our company means that Kyndryl gives you – and everyone next to you – the ability to bring your whole self to work, individually and collectively, and support the activation of our equitable culture. That’s the Kyndryl Way.
   

  

**What You Can Expect**
 With state-of-the-art resources and Fortune 100 clients, every day is an opportunity to innovate, build new capabilities, new relationships, new processes, and new value. Kyndryl cares about your well-being and prides itself on offering benefits that give you choice, reflect the diversity of our employees and support you and your family through the moments that matter – wherever you are in your life journey. Our employee learning programs give you access to the best learning in the industry to receive certifications, including Microsoft, Google, Amazon, Skillsoft, and many more. Through our company-wide volunteering and giving platform, you can donate, start fundraisers, volunteer, and search over 2 million non-profit organizations. At Kyndryl, we invest heavily in you, we want you to succeed so that together, we will all succeed.
   

  

**Get Referred!**
 If you know someone that works at Kyndryl, when asked ‘How Did You Hear About Us’ during the application process, select ‘Employee Referral’ and enter your contact's Kyndryl email address.

title: Security Governance & Compliance Officer to Surveillance Security within Saab
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing, Security and Investigations, and IT Services and IT Consulting
description:
*It´s a human right to feel safe. Our mission is to increase security in society, for its citizens and for those whose job it is to protect this right.*
*Do you agree? Apply and become a member of Surveillance Security team at Saab, were security is prioritized.*
 Your role
   

  

 We are looking for a Security Governance & Compliance Officer that thrives on working in a constantly changing and dynamic environment where you need to handle the unexpected on a daily basis.
   

  

 As Security Governance & Compliance Officer at Surveillance, you will work in an international environment where advanced security threats are part of the everyday business alongside complex business environments and projects with high business impact.
   

  

 In your role, you will provide support in interpretation and control of compliance in the area of security, as a result of law, regulation and standards, internal governance or security requirements or conditions set out in legal acts such as contracts or equivalent.
   

  

 In your role, you will be responsible for supporting, analysing, setting and follow-up the security requirements put on Surveillance regarding governance and compliance against internal- and external regulations. The scope varies throughout the entire spectrum of security disciplines, such as personnel, physical and information security.
   

  

 You will support the business in security management and in ensuring security compliance, as well as being a key player in handling various security tasks, raising security awareness and maintaining control throughout the operations.
   

  

 Your main task will be, but not exclusively:
   

  

* to provide strategic direction for the security function with regard to security governance and compliance
* to translate strategies and strategic objectives into targets and action plans
* for the security function with regards to security governance and compliance
* to establish structure for policies, standards, guidelines,
* procedures, tools and processes etcetera within the security function
* to continuously monitor, control/audit and test compliance with Surveillance security management system, security governance and internal steering documents
* to continuously monitor and evaluate applicable laws, regulations,
* requirements and agreements within the area of security governance, and if applicable adjust internal regulations accordingly
* to implement, operate and maintain Surveillance Security Management System
* to implement, operate and maintain a systematic security audit and control program.
* Support incident management and investigations
* General security support within Surveillance


 Your profile
   

  

 You are a true team player, always focusing at the team results, whether the team is the security department, the business area/unit, Saab group functions or Saab as a company.
   

  

 Required skills:
   

  

* A university degree or equivalent competence acquired through work life experience within the field of security management, crisis management and/or similar
* Good communication skills in Swedish and English, verbal and written
* Good problem solving and analytical skills
* Team player with an ability to build and maintain networks inside as well as outside own organization


 Desired skills:
   

  

* Experience from working with Swedish protective security regulations, including Swedish protective security act and/or similar
* Experience from working with security requirements and compliance and/or security frameworks
* Experience from implementation of and/or driving ISO27001 work
* The ability to improvise, adapt and overcome the unexpected
* Experience from working in an international environment


 Personal qualities will be of great importance and it is of greatest importance that you are trustworthy with strong ethics and a high personal integrity. You understand the need for balanced security in a business driven environment.
   

  

 Please note that this position will have its primary location in Stockholm, Gothenburg or Linköping but you must be able to travel national and international.
   

  

 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply
   

  

 What you will be a part of
   

  

 At Surveillance Security, we take pride in supporting our business and operation, we always go the extra mile to deliver on time, with precision and always strive to be business enablers. We want to be perceived by others as pragmatic, crucial and a integrated part in all aspects and areas of the business. We believe that an open environment, where everyone's opinions and ideas are welcome, are crucial for our future development.
   

  

 The Security Department consisting today of a variety of competences such as operational, physical, information, personnel and governance & compliance security specialist/officers/managers. You will work towards and support all our operations and installations, often in close cooperation with other parts of the Business Area or Group functions, and you will report to Head of Security at Surveillance.
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 25,500 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
   

  

 Saab designs, manufactures and maintains advanced systems in aeronautics, weapons, command and control, sensors and underwater systems. Saab is headquartered in Sweden. It has major operations all over the world and is part of the domestic defence capability of several nations. Read more about us here

title: Produktansvarig (Product Owner) till vår It-arbetsplats, Solna
description:
Enhetens uppdrag och vårt ansvar
   

  

 Arbetsförmedlingen söker nu en engagerad och kompetent Produktansvarig till produkten IT-arbetsplats inom enheten Digital Arbetsplats. Som Produktansvarig kommer du att ha ansvar för utveckling och förvaltning av våra IT-arbetsplatslösningar, samt säkerställa att dessa möter organisationens behov och mål.
   

  

 Att synas och inspirera är naturligt för oss och vi brinner för det vi levererar - en modern, driftsäker och användarvänlig It-arbetsplats där kraven är höga på att den alltid ska fungera.
   

  

 Produkten består av 3 agila team, totalt ca 20 medarbetare, där arbetssätt och arbetsplats är hybrid då vi är lokaliserade på flera platser i Sverige.
   

  

**I din roll som produktansvarig kommer du bland annat att:**
* Leda och utveckla It-arbetsplats produktportfölj där klient- och applikationshantering, mobilitetsplattform, utskriftslösning, livscykelhantering av teknisk utrustning ingår
* Definiera produktens vision, syfte och roadmap samt kommunicera detta för teamet och intressenter
* Definiera övergripande effekter och sätta mätbara mål samt arbeta med utvecklingsteamen för att leverera högkvalitativa lösningar som uppfyller dessa
* Följa upp leveranser gentemot uppsatta mål
* Samordna och driva förändringsprojekt inom IT-arbetsplatsområdet
* Samarbeta med andra enheter och sektioner inom organisationen
* Säkerställa att leveransen följer gällande lagar, regler och riktlinjer
* Prioritera backloggen


**För att passa i rollen behöver du vara:**
* Kommunikativ eftersom du är en viktig länk mellan teamen och intressenter
* Drivande både genom ditt starka självledarskap och att du leder teamen framåt
* Flexibel och kan skifta fokus och prioriteringar i en föränderlig miljö med högt tempo
* Socialt kompetent och arbetar team -och serviceinriktat.
* Du ser till det stora perspektivet och har förståelse för helheten
* Du värdesätter och bidrar till ett positivt, transparent och inkluderande samarbetsklimat


**Vårt erbjudande**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning på heltid som kan komma att inledas med sex månaders provanställning. Placeringsorten är Solna.
   

  

 Vi erbjuder dig möjligheten att arbeta på en arbetsplats där vi värdesätter balans mellan arbete och privatliv. Du får tillgång till ett generöst semesteravtal, flexibla arbetstider samt möjlighet att arbeta på distans upp till 49 procent på årsbasis. Hos oss ingår även friskvård under arbetstid och ett förmånligt friskvårdsbidrag.
   

  

 Som anställd på Arbetsförmedlingen har du också tillgång till kompetensutveckling och karriärmöjligheter inom myndigheten. Genom vårt arbete bidrar vi till ett inkluderande och hållbart samhälle, där du får möjlighet att göra en verklig skillnad för individer och för samhället i stort.
   

  

 Mer om att jobba hos oss
   

  

**Grundläggande krav för tjänsten**
* Relevant högskoleutbildning inom IT eller motsvarande erfarenhet som arbetsgivaren bedömer likvärdig
* Minst 3 års aktuell erfarenhet av arbete inom området Digital Arbetsplats/Modern Workplace
* Aktuell erfarenhet av agila arbetsmetoder eller likvärdigt arbetssätt
* Aktuell erfarenhet av produktstyrning
* Mycket goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska, både i tal och skrift


**Övriga meriter för tjänsten**
* Erfarenhet av att driva förändringsledning
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med intressentfokus


 Den statliga värdegrunden guidar oss i vårt dagliga arbete. Som anställd hos oss förväntas du arbeta rättvist, opartiskt och med hög integritet, samt bidra till att upprätthålla och stärka förtroendet för vår myndighet.
   

  

 Mer om statliga värdegrunden
   

  

 Utöver dessa kvalifikationer har du personlig förmåga och fallenhet att arbeta i enlighet med Arbetsförmedlingens medarbetarskap:
   

  

 Medarbetare på Arbetsförmedlingen:
   

  

* Tar ansvar för sina arbetsprestationer och sitt bidrag till helheten
* Anpassar sig till förändring och oförutsedda händelser
* Tar initiativ till utveckling och bidrar till förbättring


**Ansökan**
 Låter det här som en tjänst för dig? Välkommen med din ansökan senast 2025-04-25.
   

  

 Bifoga ditt CV där du specificerar årtal, månad och arbetsuppgifter för varje anställning, samt intyg som styrker kraven om utbildning och/eller arbetslivserfarenhet i din ansökan.
   

  

 Det är viktigt att du besvarar urvalsfrågorna detaljerat och sanningsenligt, för att vi ska få en tydlig bild av din erfarenhet. Om efterfrågad information inte framgår riskerar du bli bortsållad i urvalet. Du behöver inte skicka in ett personligt brev.
   

  

 Under rekryteringsprocessen kan urvalstester förekomma. Vi kommer att hålla dig informerad genom hela rekryteringsprocessen. Mer om vår rekryteringsprocess.
   

  

 Har du skyddade personuppgifter kontaktar du den rekryteringspartner som finns namngiven i annonsen så får du hjälp med att skicka in din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi arbetar aktivt för att vara en myndighet fri från diskriminering. Det är viktigt för oss att all kompetens tas tillvara och vi välkomnar alla sökande. Vi ser positivt på om du har kunskaper i något av våra nationella minoritetsspråk.
   

  

**Välkommen till jobbet som får Sverige i arbete! Här arbetar du på regeringens uppdrag för en arbetsmarknad som hjälper människor framåt. Vi frigör möjligheter så att arbetssökande hittar sysselsättning och arbetsgivare sin nästa medarbetare. För att nå målet behöver vi samarbeta, i myndigheten men också med olika externa aktörer i hela landet. Tillsammans driver vi förändring, utvecklar nya arbetssätt och skapar lösningar som gör att Sverige kan fortsätta framåt.**
 Mer om vår organisation och vårt uppdrag.
   

  

 Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100 | Ort: Solna | Län: Stockholms län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: Af-2025/0034 8515 | Kontakt: Susan Lind Nordström, Sektionschef susan.nordstrom@arbetsformedlingen.se, Moa Christner, Hr-partner moa.christner@arbetsformedlingen.se, | Facklig företrädare: Johan Thörn, ST 010-4871585, Roberto Lindmark, Saco-S 010-4865704, Tobias Persson, Seko 010-4880131, | Publicerat: 2025-04-10 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-25

title: Intern/Working Student Business Analytics & Management Consulting (Value Engineering) - Nordics
description:
We're Celonis, the global leader in Process Mining technology and one of the world's fastest-growing SaaS firms. We believe there is a massive opportunity to unlock productivity by placing data and intelligence at the core of business processes - and for that, we need you to join us.
   

  

**The Team:**
 As an Intern Business Analytics & Management Consulting you join our Value Engineering team to focus on driving and closing opportunities by identifying and selling the value Celonis can bring to customers. Our Value Engineers (VE) are the trusted advisor for customers and work on the intersection of technology and business. Value Engineers partner with sales and customers to create compelling solutions to critical business problems.
   

  

**The Role:**
 Value Engineers are the trusted advisors for our prospects and customers that bring together Product, Technology and Process Know-how to solve our prospects’ and customers’ most pressing challenges You will gain experience in executing proof of value projects and take part in technical discussions with stakeholders. By creating customer-based business cases, you support the strategic business development activities for the Nordics market.
   

  

**The work you’ll do:**
* Analyze data from our customers to increase transparency in business processes
* Understand the pain points of our customers and translate them to what the Celonis Process Intelligence Graph offers
* Quantify the business and financial potential of the Celonis Process Intelligence Graph and prepare management ready presentations
* Present findings together with your team in front of customers’ C-level and decision makers


**The qualifications you need:**
* Student of industrial engineering, business informatics, data science or a comparable program
* Strong communicational skills and interest in interacting with potential customers
* Experience in consulting and highly interested in Data Analytics
* Knowledge in SQL or related database query languages
* Analytical mindset and the ability to work in a structured manner and quickly comprehend new topics
* Effective communicator and fluent in English. Nordic languages like Swedish, Danish, Norwegian, Finnish are a plus.


**What Celonis Can Offer You:**
* The unique opportunity to work with industry-leading process mining technology
* Investment in your personal growth and skill development (clear career paths, internal mobility opportunities, L&D platform, mentorships, and more)
* Great compensation and benefits packages (equity (restricted stock units), life insurance, time off, generous leave for new parents from day one, and more). For intern and working student benefits, click here.
* Physical and mental well-being support (subsidized gym membership, access to counseling, virtual events on well-being topics, and more)
* A global and growing team of Celonauts from diverse backgrounds to learn from and work with
* An open-minded culture with innovative, autonomous teams
* Business Resource Groups to help you feel connected, valued and seen (Black@Celonis, Women@Celonis, Parents@Celonis, Pride@Celonis, Resilience@Celonis, and more)
* A clear set of company values that guide everything we do: Live for Customer Value, The Best Team Wins, We Own It, and Earth Is Our Future


**About Us:**
 Celonis helps some of the world’s largest and most esteemed brands make processes work for people, companies and the planet. With over 5,000 enterprise customer deployments across nearly every industry, the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform uses process mining and AI to give you a living digital twin of your business operation. It’s system-agnostic and without bias, and empowers companies to reduce waste, create value and benefit people across the top, bottom, and green lines. Since 2011, the Celonis platform has enabled its customers to identify more than $18 billion in value. Celonis is headquartered in Munich, Germany, and New York City, USA, with more than 20 offices worldwide.
   

  

 Get familiar with the Celonis Process Intelligence Platform by watching this video.
   

  

**Data Privacy, Equal Opportunity, and Accessibility Information**
 Celonis is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment and equal opportunity in all aspects of employment. We will not tolerate any unlawful discrimination or harassment of any kind. We make all employment decisions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, transgender status, national origin, citizenship status, religion, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or any other factor protected by applicable anti-discrimination laws. As a US federal contractor, we are committed to the principles of affirmative action in accordance with applicable laws and regulations. Different makes us better.
   

  

 Any information you submit to Celonis as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Celonis’ Statements on Data Privacy, Equal Opportunity and Accessibility.
   

  

 Please be aware of common job offer scams, impersonators and frauds. Learn more here.
   

  

 By submitting this application, you confirm that you agree to the storing and processing of your personal data by Celonis as described in our Privacy Notice for the Application and Hiring Process.

title: Senior Technical Compliance Specialist - Sportsbook
description:
**Description**
*Position at LeoVegas Group*
**About The Role**
 We’re looking for a Senior Technical Compliance Specialist to ensure our Sportsbook platform meets regulatory standards across multiple jurisdictions. In this role, you'll work with product teams, developers, and regulators to maintain compliance while delivering a top-tier betting experience. If you have a strong technical background and experience in iGaming or sports betting compliance.
   

  

**YOU WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR:**
* Mastering Sportsbook product compliance requirements primarily for the Northern Europe and LatAm regions (e.g. Denmark, Sweden, Brazil) with the possibility of further expansions, ensure that all the internal tools are up to date with the latest applicable version of the requirements and provide interpretation and guidance as appropriate;
* Delivering technical requirements to the Product and Tech organisation and review designs against compliance;
* Contributing to promoting a compliance culture within the organisation;
* Being highly involved in technical audit activities;
* Mentoring and managing team members as required;
* Supporting and closely cooperating with the Compliance team to address findings and incidents,
* Contributing to improving and consolidating the Compliance posture of the Group;
* Supporting the internal teams with replies to technical compliance queries;
* Monitoring and assessing changing requirements in new and existing markets and ensure timely analysis and announcements.


******OUR SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE WILL HAVE:
   

  

 Essential skills:******
* A degree in the STEM fields or any subject which can support the role.
* At least 3-4 years of relevant experience in the compliance space from the online gambling industry.
* Knowledge in sportsbook product from compliance perspective.
* Expertise in relation to the technical implementation of regulatory compliance requirements.
* Understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management are a plus.
* B2B expertise.


 Nice to have skills:
   

  

* Previous experience in regulatory reporting.
* Understanding of the Agile methodology and Change management.


****WHO ARE WE?****
****At the core of LeoVegas Group, is Team Leo. Our culture is our foundation and is what enables us to innovate, build, and lead as we trailblaze our way through the igaming industry. We’re a team of over 1800 innovators, initiators, and groundbreakers working in a fast-paced and agile environment across 16 offices world-wide** 
 .**
**Benefits**
* Hybrid work policy
* 4 weeks of Workation (T&C apply)
* 30 annual vacation days
* Occupational Pension
* 5,000 SEK wellness contribution annually
* Parental Leave Top-Up
* Possibility to enrol in a private health care insurance for both you and your partner
* 1,500 SEK equipment allowance
* Benify - benefits portal with many offers and discounts
* We offer a relocation package with accommodation and flights!


**JOIN US!**
 In our pride, we like to empower our teammates to find their roar and run with their wildest ideas. We don’t wait around for things to happen, we pounce and make it happen!
   

  

 If you think you would be a good fit for the Leo pride - give us a roar!
   

  

 \*\*As our company working language is English we’d like to see your CV in English please\*\*

title: Product Owner (m/f/d) Voicebot
description:
**We are looking for a**
**Product Owner (m/f/d) Voicebot**
**for our team at the locations Berlin, Amsterdam, or Heerenveen to develop the next generation of fintech.**
**Your key responsibilities will be:**
* Define and execute the long-term roadmap for the VoiceBot, ensuring alignment with customer service strategies and business goals.
* Stay updated with industry trends in conversational AI, automation, and natural language processing (NLP) to drive innovation.
* Oversee the design, deployment, and optimization of VoiceBot capabilities to ensure seamless customer interactions.
* Continuously analyze and enhance AI-driven features to improve contextual understanding, intent recognition, and conversational accuracy.
* Act as the primary liaison between business units, IT, customer service, and AI development teams, ensuring that VoiceBot capabilities meet business needs.
