Har du frågor om rekryteringsprocessen är du välkommen att kontakta Corinne Östlund (HRBP) på 076-124 22 32.
   

  

 Vi tycker det är viktigt med kompetensbaserad rekrytering och ett högt säkerhetstänk, därför tillämpar vi tester och bakgrundskontroller i alla våra rekryteringar. Du kan läsa mer om det här.
   

  

 Tjänsten avser en tillsvidareanställning som inleds med sex månaders provanställning.

title: Cyber security Consultant
job_function: Information Technology, Consulting, and Business Development
company_industry: Computer and Network Security, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Business Consulting and Services
description:
**Vill du jobba med varierande uppdrag jämsides med de allra mest erfarna i IT-branschen?** 




  





 Midagon är en nordisk, oberoende verksamhets- och IT-konsultfirma specialiserad på att genomföra utmanande transformationsprojekt och program. Vi är över 200 anställda i Norden, varav närmare 100 befinner sig i Sverige. Vi driver uppdrag i både privat och offentlig sektor, åt stora globala aktörer såväl som nationella företag. Våra uppdrag varierar i storlek, men gemensamt är att vi hjälper våra kunder att lyckas med sina komplexa transformationer, där vi kan stoltsera med långa kundrelationer samt flertalet egna ramavtal.
 



  





 Våra erfarna konsulter har en bakgrund inom cybersäkerhetsområdet med fokus på bland annat riskhantering, hotanalyser men även specialkompetens inom specifika ämnesområden som säkerhetsarkitektur och nätverksförsvar. Hos oss hittar du de bästa av de bästa. Ett ypperligt kvitto är våra utmärkelser som DI Gasellföretag, Sveriges nöjdaste kunder (Radar), 8 års certifiering av ”Great place to work” samt Superföretag av Veckans affärer.
 



  





 Vill du också vara del av ett team av seniora konsulter, där avslappnad atmosfär går hand i hand med ett engagerat arbete och sund livsbalans?
 



  





**Din roll** 




 I denna roll leder du kundens utmaningar och förändringsprojekt kopplat till informationssäkerhet och Cybersecurity i nära samarbete med våra eller kundens säkerhatsteam och verksamhetsutvecklare. Med din expertis fungerar du som en oberoende rådgivare och säkerställer att kunden når sina affärsmål genom säkra och hållbara IT- och verksamhetsprocesser.
 



  





 Internt på Midagon blir du en del av ett team av seniora konsulter med bred erfarenhet inom digital transformation. Teamet har både djup teknisk förståelse och strategisk kompetens gällande regelverk, ramverk och cybersecurity samt erfarenhet från olika branscher och teknologiplattformar, där samarbete och kunskapsutbyte är centrala delar av arbetet.
 



  





**Den vi söker** 




 Som person ser vi att du är utåtriktad, strukturerad och inspirerar din omgivning. I rollen som säkerhetskonsult ska du ha erfarenhet av att granska en verksamhets nuläge utifrån någon eller alla infallsvinklar så som människan, processen eller tekniken.
 



  





**Som person ser vi att du har:** 




 · Har mångårig konsulterfarenhet
 



 · Analys, planering och införande av LIS
 



 · Analys, planering och införande av organisatoriska och/eller tekniska skyddsåtgärder
 



 · Kontinuitets- och katastrofplanering
 



 · Informationsidentifiering, klassning och skyddsåtgärder
 



 · Kommunicerar obehindrat på både svenska och engelska
 



  





 Du är van att presentera underlag för styrgrupper och företagsledning lik väl som att prata övergripande teknik med IT-avdelningens medarbetare. Certifieringar såsom exempelvis CISSP, CISA CISM eller motsvarande är extra meriterande.
 



  





**Är du nyfiken?** 




 Läs gärna mer om oss och våra uppdrag på: Våra tidigare uppdrag, , på hemsidan kan du också enkelt registrera din ansökan. Har du ytterligare frågor eller funderingar, tveka inte att kontakta Martin Nilsson inom HR-& rekrytering på martin.nilsson@midagon.com / 070-2257833 eller vår Head of people and culture, Hanna Fredriksson på hanna.fredriksson@midagon.com / 076-0074551.
 



  





 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Qlik expert
description:
**Stretch Qonnect fortsätter att växa!**
 Brinner du för att lösa affärsproblem med strategisk dataanvändning och smarta integrationer?
   

  

 Är du redo att växa med oss och göra avtryck på Stockholmsmarknaden tillsammans med Stretch Qonnect?
   

  

**Klart du är, och vi vill ha med dig på resan!**
 Stretch Qonnects framgång i Sverige fortsätter och nu utökar vi teamet i Stockholm. Sedan starten för 12 år sedan i Köpenhamn, har Stretch Qonnect etablerat sig på den danska och svenska marknaden. Vi är nu närmare 40 medarbetare som hjälper företag på den lokala som den globala marknaden med sin dataresa.
   

  

 Vi använder främst Qliks plattform, som erbjuder marknadens ledande produkter. Genom vårt nära samarbete med Qlik tillhandahåller vi våra kunder expertlösningar skapade av våra certifierade konsulter och säljer även vår egen produktlinje av Qlik-produkter med namnet Qloud Cover, som används över hela världen.
   

  

 Mitt i centrala Stockholm finner du vårt hem, ett kontor som ger en hemma hos-känsla med moderna inslag.
   

  

**Vi Söker Dig Som**
* Har ett par års erfarenhet av Qlik Sense och Qlik Cloud
* Är analytisk och lösningsorienterad med stark förmåga att kommunicera komplex information på ett enkelt sätt
* Har erfarenhet av att arbeta med dataintegration
* Besitter kunskap om relationsdatabaser och datamodellering
* Har utmärkta svenska kommunikationsfärdigheter
* Är en problemlösare - du ser alternativa lösningar när andra möter hinder
* Älskar utmaningar, har driv och beslutsamhet
* Trivs i teamarbete


**Vi Erbjuder**
* Spännande och varierande projekt med intressanta företag i olika branscher
* Möjligheten att arbeta med den senaste tekniken
* All din utbildning du behöver för din roll
* Skandinaviska kick off:er med hela Stretchgruppen
* Frihet under ansvar
* "Lunch - and learn" varannan vecka
* Generöst friskvårdsbidrag
* Förmånlig tjänstepension och försäkringar
* Ett glatt gäng som trivs & har kul tillsammans. Vi hjälper varandra i vått och torrt


 Tveka inte att höra av dig!
   

  

 Stretchgänget

title: Senior Software Engineer (Apache Kafka)
description:
We’re a global team of over 400 people, working together to push the boundaries of open-source technology and multi-cloud solutions. Our vision is to become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone, leveraging the most popular open-source technologies like Apache Kafka®, Aiven for PostgreSQL®, Aiven for Clickhouse®, and Aiven for OpenSearch® to help companies accelerate time-to-market, drive efficiency, and build innovative solutions across any cloud. Right now, we’re looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to join our team who shares our passion for forward-thinking and innovative approaches.
 



  





 The Engineering team at Aiven lies at the core of our organization. This is a great opportunity to become an integral member of the team as a Senior Software Engineer. We look for engineers who can work around problems by finding new angles. Thinking sideways. You will have the opportunity to collaborate with world-class tech people solving the toughest problems, where almost every project you work on is more complex and technically challenging than the previous one. If you relish pushing your technical boundaries, come join us. Because if you can truly think sideways, you’ll never look back.
 



  





**Who We Are** 




 So, how do we become the trusted Data & AI Platform for everyone? By listening closely to our customers and taking action to ensure they achieve their business goals. You see, the software we create is merely a means of delivering value. Our thinking is customer-first. That’s why our customers are at the front and center of all we do. And in the spirit of sideways thinking, we’re by their side as well. Actively helping them solve their challenges. Collaborating. Sharing. And innovating. In other words, it really isn’t just about who we are. It’s about who our customers are – and where they want to be.
 



  





**Our values** 




 We want individuals who can embody our values of ownership, courage, and openness.
 



 What does that mean in practice?
 



 We take ownership of the problems we solve. What we do is about improving life for our customers, enabling them to meet their goals. So we own our decisions and mistakes. Sometimes that takes courage. But we don’t falter – we take on challenges with confidence. And right at our heart is openness. We’re always open to new ideas – from wherever and whoever they come.
 



  





**The Role:** 




 We are looking for a
 **Senior Software Engineer** 
 to work on our cloud operations platform turning the best open source technologies into frustration-free cloud services. You will be part of the team that is focused on developing the cloud Apache Kafka service and improving its scalability and reliability. The team is also responsible for Apache Kafka Connect, Apache Kafka MirrorMaker2, several open-source Apache Kafka connectors, Karapace (Schema Registry and Kafka REST equivalent).
 



 While we use Python extensively, this is not a hard requirement, as we are looking for senior engineers who like our mission and are willing to embrace Python.
 



  





**What You'll Do:** 



* Writing high-quality, maintainable code and releasing quality features
* Performing peer reviews and participating in technical discussions both at the team level and among the product development engineering domain
* Contributing to technical planning and backlog management
* Helping investigate and resolve customer issues
* Mentor and empower other engineers around you



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 Don’t worry if your experience doesn’t line up perfectly – we still encourage you to apply! We believe in investing in our crabs’ professional growth.
 



**Must-have** 



* Excellent development skills, preferably in Python.
* The urge to write automated tests
* Experience using Linux in development
* Good understanding of security (software, networking)
* Fluency in English, verbal and written



  





**Nice-to-have** 



* Hands-on experience developing and/or operating Apache Kafka and Apache MirrorMaker2
* Experience and/or interest in Infrastructure as Code
* Distributed systems knowledge
* Experience in cloud DBaaS production environments



  





**Our Offer** 




 If you ask us what’s the best thing about working for Aiven, many will probably say it’s the high concentration of talent from around the world that we have here. Enjoy the agile environment of a hyperscale scale-up where you can truly make an impact and have fun while at it.
 



  





**We invest in you** 



* Participate in Aiven’s equity plan.
* With Aiven locations spanning the globe, we want all of our crabs to find the right balance with our hybrid work policy.
* Get the equipment you need to set yourself up for success.
* Step up your career game with real employer support (use one of our learning platforms, annual learning budget, and more).
* Get comprehensive wellbeing support through our global Employee Assistance Program.



  





**Make a difference at Aiven** 



* Contribute to open source projects that you find relevant outside of work - and get paid for it. Our Plankton program recognizes extra work to the open source ecosystem for developers and non-developers alike.
* Use up to 5 days per year to volunteer for a good cause of your choice.
* Join one of our team member resource groups - empower yourself and others in missions that resonate with you.



  





**What Else** 




 As well as the above Global Benefits, we have regional benefits specific to your country of residence. We would be happy to discuss these further with you during the interview process.
 



  





**Amazing, What’s Next** 




 If you think Aiven is the place for you, send us your CV, and we’ll get in touch!
 



  





**How To Recognise And Avoid Employment Scams** 




 There has been a rise in fake job postings used by scammers to get personal information. Please familiarise yourself with the red flags of a potential scam.
 



 Here at Aiven, all of our emails relating to recruitment come from an @aiven.io, @greenhouse.io or @eu.greenhouse.io domain and all of our interviews are conducted over video call or in person, our interviews will never occur over text or chat. If you’re unsure of the legitimacy of a job opportunity/offer pertaining to Aiven, please don’t hesitate to reach out to us at recruitment@aiven.io.
 



  





**Equal Opportunities** 




 Aiven provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified employees and applicants for employment without regard to age, gender identity, national or ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation, physical and mental ability, marital and family status or without regard to any other similar personal attributes. Aiven aligns with applicable local laws governing inclusivity in employment in every location in which the company operates. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and any other terms and conditions related to employment.
 



 At Aiven, we are committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities or special needs in our working environment and job application procedures. We make all reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities or who otherwise need support to thrive in the workplace. We are committed to continuously improving workplace accessibility. There is an option to request a discussion in the application process but if you have any questions before applying please write to us at recruitment@aiven.io.

title: Backend Developer (Go)
description:
At Ubiquiti Inc., we create technology platforms for Businesses, Smart Homes, and Internet Service Providers, driven by our goal to connect everyone, everywhere. To date, Ubiquiti has shipped over 100 million devices worldwide, from ISP networking products to next generation of IT solutions. Our growth is made possible by the dedicated team of hundreds behind the scenes. From software developers and product managers to designers and strategists, Team UI is driven to achieve our common goal: Rethinking IT. At Ubiquiti, you’ll heighten your potential and broaden your horizons - all while shaping the future of connectivity.
   

  

**Join forces with us on our mission to build a better IT industry. We are currently looking for a highly skilled Backend Developer (Go) to our team in Stockholm, Sweden.**
***Please note that applicants must live in Sweden and hold a valid work permit at the time of application to be considered for this role.***
**Responsibilities**
* Develop efficient, scalable, and maintainable backend services
* Develop integrations with network device firmware and other applications
* Integrate feature designs with larger software systems
* Co-work with cloud architects, backend developers, frontend developers, designers, and other stakeholders


**Requirements**
* 5+ years of experience with Golang is required
* Experience with RDBMS and NoSQL
* Experience with developing REST and MQTT API
* Experience with Git/GitHub
* Experience with Linux and Docker environments
* Good understanding of SOLID principles
* Ability to work independently within a high-talent team
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong sense of ownership of tasks and responsibilities
* Highly proficient in English (written and spoken)


**Nice To Have**
* Familiarity with Java development
* Experience with Spring or other web framework knowledge
* Knowledge of Bash and Unix
* Knowledge of WebRTC and WebSockets
* Good understanding of networking protocols and architectures
* Experience developing AWS cloud services / DevOps
* Experience with SD-WAN and/or VPN technologies
* Familiarity with the Agile software development processes


**Benefits**
* International work environment
* Competitive compensation package including wellness allowance, occupational pension, medical insurance, private health insurance, life insurance and work-injury insurance
* Five weeks of holiday per year
* Flexible work hours and hybrid work model
* Modern office space located in Epicenter (Hötorget)
* Access to all the latest Ubiquiti products and prototypes for home use and tests

title: SAP Analytics Architect
description:
Scania is undergoing a transformation from being a leading supplier of trucks, buses, and engines to providing complete and sustainable transport solutions. Together with TRATON and our sister brands MAN, Volkswagen Truck & Bus, and International, we are working to shape the future of mobility with innovative and environmentally conscious solutions.
   

  

 Our values – customer first, respect, team spirit, responsibility, and elimination of waste – are at the heart of everything we do. Together, we are at the forefront of creating a sustainable future.
   

  

**Role Summary**
 As an SAP Analytics Architect, you’ll play a key role in designing and delivering modern analytics solutions using SAP's latest tools — such as Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). You’ll collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs, shape strategic data models, and propose end-to-end analytics solutions that bring measurable value.
   

  

 You’ll also help ensure solution integrity by adhering to best practices and development standards while supporting the evolution of Scania’s analytics landscape. Your ability to connect business challenges with smart technical design will be key to success in this role.
   

  

**Job Responsibilities**
* Design and architect scalable analytics solutions using SAP tools, with a focus on Datasphere and SAP Analytics Cloud
* Lead and facilitate workshops to gather business requirements and translate them into technical designs
* Collaborate with business specialists to align solutions with process needs and system landscape
* Maintain architecture documentation and ensure solutions follow SAP best practices and Scania’s internal guidelines
* Contribute to solution reviews and change management processes, minimizing technical debt and ensuring long-term maintainability
* Adapt quickly to non-SAP tools in Scania’s analytics environment, providing integrated solution proposals where needed


**Who You Are**
 You are a skilled and strategic analytics professional with a passion for connecting business needs to smart, scalable technical solutions. You combine strong technical expertise with excellent communication skills, and you’re comfortable leading both deep-dive technical discussions and business-focused conversations. We believe you’ll thrive in this role if you bring:
   

  

  

* A degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
* A few years of experience in SAP Analytics
* Knowledge in data modeling, Datasphere, and SAP Analytics Cloud
* Experience with workshop facilitation and translating business challenges into technical solutions
* A solid understanding of business processes or SAP functional modules
* Strong communication and stakeholder management skills
* Experience maintaining architecture documentation and ensuring consistency across solutions
* Experience with SAP Analytics Cloud Planning is a plus


**Scania Offers**
 We offer a dynamic, flexible workplace with hybrid work options, including Scania Sergel and other locations. With a structured development plan and courses, Scania supports your career growth both locally and internationally.
   

  

 Benefits include training at our health center Gröndal or wellness allowance, result bonus, flexible hours, and company car leasing. Scania also hosts events for employees and their families, and Stockholm residents enjoy direct access to Södertälje via Scania Job express buses.
   

  

**Application**
 Your application should include a CV and any relevant certificates. We welcome all applicants and strive for diversity in our recruitment processes.
   

  

 Apply as soon as possible, no later than 2025-04-20. Screening will take place on an ongoing basis during the application period. Logical and personality tests may be used as part of the selection process, and a background check may be required for this role.
   

  

 If you have questions or would like more information, please contact: Jakub Zurek (jakub.zurek@scania.com)
   

  

**We look forward to your application!**

title: Packet Core Architect
description:
Choosing Capgemini means choosing a company where you will be empowered to shape your career in the way you’d like, where you’ll be supported and inspired by a collaborative community of colleagues around the world, and where you’ll be able to reimagine what’s possible. Join us and help the world’s leading organizations unlock the value of technology and build a more sustainable, more inclusive world.
   

  

**Your Role**
 As a
 **5G Core Architect** 
 , you will be responsible for leading the design, implementation, and optimization of our 5G Core network. You will ensure seamless integration with access and transport networks while contributing to the evolution of next-generation communication systems.
   

  

*In this role, you will play a key role in:*
* Developing and defining the end-to-end architecture for the 5G Core network, including AMF, SMF, UPF, NRF, PCF, and other critical components.
* Leading the deployment and configuration of 5G Core functions in compliance with 3GPP standards and operator requirements.
* Ensuring seamless Integration of the 5G Core with RAN, Edge computing platforms, and Transport networks.
* Analyzing and optimizing 5G Core performance, Scalability, and Reliability to meet KPIs for latency, throughput, and resource efficiency.
* Driving innovation by evaluating emerging technologies like Network slicing and Private 5G networks to align with business goals.
* Leading troubleshooting efforts for Core network issues, ensuring rapid resolution, minimal downtime, and implementation of new features.
* Conducting security assessments and ensuring compliance with Telecom security regulations.
* Utilizing Spirent Simulator to test multiple scenarios for 5G Core network validation.


**Your Profile**
* Strong expertise in 5G Core architecture and 3GPP network standards.
* Experience in Designing and Implementing 5G Core network functions.
* Hands-on experience in Network slicing, Edge computing, and Private 5G networks.
* Expertise in Core network integration, troubleshooting, and performance tuning.
* Proficiency in Protocols such as HTTP/2, PFCP, GTP, SCTP, and REST APIs.
* Strong understanding of Security, Encryption, and Authentication mechanisms for 5G Core.
* Experience with Network testing tools such as Spirent, IXIA, or similar.
* Excellent Problem-solving, communication, and leadership skills.


*Note: You will be required to pass through SC Security Clearance if you are successful in this recruitment process, which is a condition of undertaking the role.*
**What We Believe You Will Enjoy About Working Here**
 We recognize the significance of flexible work arrangements to provide support. Be it remote work, or flexible work hours, you will get an environment to maintain healthy work life balance.
   

  

* At the heart of our mission is your career growth. Our array of career growth programs and diverse professions are crafted to support you in exploring a world of opportunities.
* Exposure to cutting-edge technologies in the 5G and telecommunications domain, including professional certifications in telecom and cloud technologies.

title: R&D Engineer - HVDC Control and Protection Application Software
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**

As a R&D Engineer – HVDC Control & Protection Application Software, you will be part of the Technology & Solutions Development (Business R&D) organization in HVDC, Hitachi Energy, Ludvika, Sweden. At HVDC R&D Control and Protection System Solutions, we work extensively with Real-Time Hardware-In Loop innovation and development. The cutting-edge solutions developed in this team are the building blocks for commercial HVDC projects, enhancing the HVDC Control and Protection System offering by Hitachi Energy.


The HVDC technology has been on the market for the past 60 years and is an enabler for renewable energy integration, supporting future energy transition for a sustainable future. Please find out more about our world-leading technology at www.hitachienergy.com/HVDC.


You will join a global and dynamic team of 50+ colleagues, based in Sweden and India. This position will be based in Ludvika, Sweden.

**How you will make an impact**

* As R&D Engineer, you will contribute to the development and testing of various control and protection applications for HVDC.
* The application software developed will be used as the building blocks, from which HVDC projects all over the world will take their first steps.
* Electrical system/ automation programming and contributing to testing strategies of the same, as per industry standards and guidelines.
* Your innovative and smart applications will enable HVDC to fulfill advanced technology needs and derive higher customer value.
* You will work with our latest HVDC technology and solutions, in collaboration with colleagues located worldwide.

**Your background**

* You have relevant knowledge in the area of High-level C&P application software for HVDC, Hardware-In Loop development and validation, Real Time simulation.
* Knowledge of HVDC technology is a pre-requisite, and experience of the MACH™ system will be an added advantage
* Genuine technical interest to work and contribute to future development in the field of HVDC grid connection technologies.
* Ability to work well in Agile project teams and deliver towards common goals, with attention to details and accuracy.
* You contribute with a strong problem-solving mindset and endurance to deliver and document high-quality technical solutions.
* As you will be part of a global business, fluency in English is required, written and spoken.

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

title: R&D Scientist in Electromagnetics for High Power applications
description:
**Description**


**The opportunity**


Innovation is the heart of Hitachi Energy, and our research centres are the backbone. Join us if you have outstanding scientific or technical expertise as well as drive and passion. You will work in dynamic, motivated, and creative team with a wide range of experience and competence and with access to highly advanced laboratory facilities.


For our research center in Sweden, we are looking for a research scientist with expertise in the area of Electromagnetics for High Power Applications. You will work in dynamic, motivated, and creative teams with a wide range of experience and competence and with access to highly advanced laboratory facilities.  

  

**How you´ll make an impact**

* As an expert in the field of electromagnetics for high power applications, your role would involves identifying technical requirements and driving innovation in the area of sustainable energy infrastructure for the future power grids.
* You will be responsible for developing and providing solutions for technical challenges in R&D projects. This will include validating new concepts through software simulations or laboratory tests and optimizing these solutions to meet the necessary technical requirements.
* Your work will also involve managing R&D projects or work-packages with a structured working style, target-oriented strategy, and effective leadership.
* You will be expected to create ideas and proposals for R&D projects that improve manufacturing processes and design for high-voltage power apparatus, with a clear business focus.
* In addition, you will be required to support other R&D projects that require electromagnetics competence.
* You will be expected to interact and actively communicate with team members, customers, suppliers, as well as collaborators in partner companies and universities.
* Your work will result in delivering outcomes in the form of software, hardware, technical reports, patent applications, scientific papers, and presentations.
* You will also be expected to build a network in the company and actively share your knowledge and expertise.

**Your background**

* PhD in either of the following areas - Electrical Engineering, High Voltage Engineering, Power System Engineering, or a related field with a strong focus on electromagnetic modelling.
* Demonstrated expertise in computational electromagnetism.
* You have prior experience of designing and conducting relevant experimental studies.
* Knowledge and/or research experience with high-voltage power apparatus such as transformers, reactors, generators, or switchgears.
* Knowledge of high-voltage phenomena such as corona, partial discharge, insulation breakdown and degradation would be beneficial.
* Experience in electromagnetic interference and compatibility would also be advantageous, as would experience in designing high-voltage power apparatus.
* If you have previous experience of leading R&D projects, this would be considered an advantage.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, team player attitude, creative and take initiative.
* You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.

**What We Offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* A mentor to support you throughout the onboarding phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

title: Solution Engineer - Body Worn Solutions
description:
Job Title
Solution Engineer - Body Worn Solutions
Job Description
ARE YOU OUR NEXT BODY WORN SOLUTIONS ENGINEER EMEA?
Are you passionate about innovative Body Worn solutions and seeing them come to life with our customers? Do you believe in strength in numbers and raising the confidence and skill of your colleagues? Then you might be the right person to join our team! We are looking for a Body Worn expert engineer to join our Engineering, Training and Portfolio strategy team in EMEA.  

  

This role can be based in any Axis EMEA office and will report to the team Manager Markus Lai.
WHAT WILL YOU DO AS A BODY WORN SOLUTIONS ENGINEER EMEA?
We are offering the chance to join our team as a dedicated technical expert within the Body Worn Solutions/Wearables domain. This role is focused on Axis Body Worn technologies and we would want you to bring previous experience from companies in the Body Worn industry.  

  

As a Body Worn Solutions Engineer EMEA, your expertise will drive the technical evolution of our Body Worn solutions—bridging cutting-edge product development with real-world customer applications. Your role is pivotal in shaping the next generation of wearable technologies, not just deploying them. You will be a central point within our EMEA sales organization for Body Worn technical knowledge and support.  

  

A key part of your role will be to actively identify and support new business opportunities from a technical perspective. You’ll work closely with sales, marketing, and product management to ensure that customer needs are understood and met with innovative technical solutions.  

  

Your profile should reflect a deep understanding of Body Worn technology and a strong motivation to be a subject matter expert and a source of knowledge for colleagues and customers. You will be responsible for knowledge transfer and competence building across the full chain of stakeholders.  

  

This role supports Body Worn technology from early inception phases through launch, pilot implementations, and feedback to next-generation development. Your responsibilities will include internal and external technical support, field work, and collaboration across departments. You will also be involved in the project design and development phase, leveraging your industry experience.
Responsibilities* Provide market insights and trends specific to Body Worn technologies to inform product roadmaps.
* Transfer knowledge of Body Worn products, technologies, and market trends internally and externally.
* Understand the competitive landscape within the Body Worn segment.
* Support pre-sales and professional services activities, including field visits.
* Drive and support pilots and proof of concept implementations.
* Represent Axis at speaking engagements, conferences, and internal events focused on Body Worn solutions.
* Be part of the Body Worn product launch team, ensuring technical success and customer readiness.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?
We are looking for a focused and self-motivated team player with a strong technical background and proven experience working in Body Worn solution companies. You should have a pre-sales mindset and experience with trialing and launching Body Worn solutions into customer environments.  

  

You will work with a wide range of stakeholders, from internal R&D teams to senior customer decision-makers. Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills are essential. Your background includes at least 5 years of experience developing, deploying, or integrating Body Worn solutions in large-scale environments.
We believe you have the following skills and experience:* Strong passion for Body Worn technologies and new business development
* Analytical, inquiring, and critical thinking approach
* Creative and curious mindset
* Drive and a self-disciplined approach to achieving results
* Solid content creation and presentation skills
* Experience in technical pre-sales and customer-facing roles


Education and Experience* Proven experience from Body Worn companies or similar wearable technology environments
* Experience with IP Networking (LAN/WAN)
* Familiarity with security frameworks (e.g., ISO 27001, NIST, Zero Trust)
* Knowledge in surveillance, video, and optics is a plus
* Software development or system integration experience preferred
* B.S. degree in computer science or a related field is preferred


This role involves travel for customer meetings, pilots, and visits to our HQ in Lund, Sweden, as well as other EMEA locations.  

  

READY TO ACT?  

Axis is a company realizing the benefits of a diverse workforce. We know that diversity in groups creates a better working environment and promotes creativity—something that is fundamental for our success. Come join us!
To be considered for this role, please submit your CV and Cover Letter in English.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-04-27*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.

title: Marketing Coordinator
description:
**Marketing Coordinator**
=========================

#### **At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story.**

### **This position reports to**


Business Intelligence Manager

### **Your role and responsibilities**


About the job • Full-Time Regular/Permanent • Based at Swedish HQ in Malmö • Communication, Marketing and Branding • Global Leader and manufacturer of automated machine solutions Take the next step in your career at B&R – a member of the ABB Group – and join a global team commit-ted to driving the transformation of society and industry towards a more productive and sustainable future. At B&R, diversity and inclusion are at the core of who we are. As part of the ABB Group, we are dedicat-ed to creating an inclusive environment that embraces and celebrates individual differences across all dimensions, including gender, LGBTQ+, abilities, ethnicity, and generations. We are currently expanding our Marketing Team in Malmö and are looking for a Marketing Coordinator to join us on this exciting journey. In this role, you will play a key part in strengthening B&R Sweden’s marketing communication, with a special focus on digital marketing. You will collaborate closely with both the sales and marketing teams to design and implement integrated campaigns that enhance brand visibility and drive lead gen-eration. Your responsibilities will include maintaining and updating our communication channels, including the company website and social media platforms, to ensure engaging and current content. You will also support the planning and execution of a variety of events such as conferences, trade shows, academy sessions, promotional activities, and technical days – both at our Co-creation Lab OrangePoint in Malmö and on-site at customer locations. Additionally, you will coordinate marketing budgets and expenses, monitor key performance indicators, and conduct return-on-investment analyses. Supporting the sales team with promotional materials and helping to manage customer relationships will also be a part of your role, with the overall aim of ensur-ing high customer satisfaction.


### **Qualifications for the role**

* YOUR BACKGROUND
* Experience in a similar role including digital marketing
* Experience and personal interest in digitalization and marketing automation
* Proven ability and experience to communicate effectively with partners, vendors, internal cus-tomers, colleagues and other stakeholders
* Positive and service minded attitude with customer focus, and a team player
* Seeking continuous improvements in processes and working methods
* Strong organizational skills, ability to prioritize and working well under pressure.
* Good proficiency with MS office 365, Teams, Sharepoint and Adobe Creative Suite
* REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS
* Knowledge and Relevant Education in Marketing Communication
* Knowledge in Digital Marketing and Marketing Automation tools
* Content Management CRS like AEM or Typo 3
* Experience Social Media editor, especially LinkedIn, but preferably also Instagram/Meta/X and YouTube
* Coordinator of Marketing Events and Campaigns
* Marketing work experience: 1 year minimum (Preferred +3years)
* SKILLS & ABILITIES
* We believe that you are a positive, creative and proactive doer with excellent planning skills.
* Strong in marketing communication and project management skills.
* Able to express technically complex content in easy-to-understand form.
* We also expect that you:
* + Have a bachelor’s degree or equivalent in marketing, communication, or similar.
	+ Have excellent written and verbal communication skills, fluency in Swedish and English are mandatory.
	+ Are structured, work well independently, and can meet strict deadlines.
* Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.
* + Excellent copywriting skills with the ability to create compelling content for various marketing chan-nels.
	+ Proficient in analyzing data and making data-driven decisions.
* MERITING SKILLS
* It is also considered an advantageous if you have basic knowledge in:
* B2B Marketing strategy
* CRM Salesforce
* ABM Account Based Marketing Strategy
* SEO search engine optimization, SEM search engine marketing and CRO conversion rate optimi-zation
* Marketing AI (ChatGPT/OpenAI, Copilot and other relevant tools)
* Google Ads, Analytics and Data Studio.
* Adobe Creative Suite, especially Photoshop and InDesign.
* Evalanche Marketing Software
* Knowledge in Video Studio and broadcasting webinar
* Influencer Marketing
* And of course, it is a plus if you are technically curious and like to work with intelligent automation and software solutions.

### **More about us**


At B&R – a member of the ABB Group, you can expect an exciting and challenging job with an individual-ly tailored introductory training. You will work in agile teams where you can actively contribute and drive ideas forward. Our flexible work models (e.g. flextime, hybrid) offer you an optimal work-life bal-ance. Our unique B&R spirit is characterized by appreciation, communication at eye level and an informal work culture. We offer you customized training and development programs as well as exciting development opportunities within the company. Numerous other B&R benefits (Parental Leave Program, Employee Assistance Program and many more) round off our offer. We look forward to receiving your application (documents submitted in English are appreciated). Please note that interviews will be held on an ongoing basis. Last day to apply is April 30th 2025. If you want to discover more about B&R and ABB, take another look at our website www.br-automation.com and www.abb.com. Recruiting Manager Kalle Hansson, kalle.hansson@br-automation.com will answer your questions about the position. Union representatives - Sveriges Ingenjörer: Nicolin Ahlqvist, +46 720 77 41 90; Ledarna: Lenny Larsson, +46 706 32 85 47; Unionen: Roger L. Gustavsson, +46 730 30 30 36. All other questions can be directed to Talent Partner Joacim Jonasson +46 72 461 26 77. ABB Data Privacy Statement: https://new.abb.com/privacy-notice/candidate ABB's Machine Automation Division, also known to our customers as B&R, is an innovative automation company headquartered in Austria with additional offices around the world. B&R became part of ABB's Robotics & Discrete Automation division in 2017 and, together with the ABB Robotics division, employs more than 11,000 people at over 100 locations in more than 53 countries. As a leading global provider of automation solutions, B&R develops, produces, and sells industrial elec-tronics, software solutions and mechatronic solutions as well as technologies for machine and factory automation. Since 2020, B&R's automation portfolio has also included Codian brand delta robots. With its innovative solutions, B&R sets new standards and consistently exceeds its customers' expectations. We value people from different backgrounds. Could this be your story? Apply today or visit www.abb.com to read more about us and learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory

title: Senior Verification Engineer
description:
Stockholm, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

**What you’ll do at Elekta**
============================


As a Senior Verification Engineer, you will be part of a hardware team, developing **mechanical and electronic solutions** in an agile framework, for our Linear Accelerator portfolio. You’ll play a key role in all phases of the verification process, including planning, specification, execution, and reporting for both new solutions and modifications to existing products.


You will collaborate closely with the hardware designers and other verification functions setting up environments for testing to ensure a testable design and provide early feedback on the product performance. Additionally, general understanding of mechanical or mechatronics systems, handling tools (i.e. power tools), practical experimental work, test tool development, configuration management, and requirements tracking are essential aspects of this role.

#### **Responsibilities**


In this role, your responsibilities will include:

* Participate in all stages of development projects, with a focus on verification, requirements engineering, documentation, and configuration management, in compliance with company standards.
* Design, develop, execute, and maintain test cases and environments
* Perform exploratory and regression testing.
* Identify defects and report bugs with a strong attention to detail.
* Develop and validate test tools.
* Create and review verification documents.
* Review technical product documents, including drawings and design-related materials.
* Contribute to the development of technical testing strategies.
* Manage test sites and related activities.
* Keep up with the latest technical and clinical advancements in the field.


Are you a hands-on person, comfortable working in labs or garage environments, experienced in handling power tools and following safety instructions, and naturally curious about how things work? Then please keep reading and apply!

**What you bring**
==================


To succeed in this role, you should demonstrate high integrity and strong attention to detail throughout the verification process. You should also be confident in advocating for necessary changes to ensure product quality and safety. This is an individual contributor role that involves close collaboration with multiple stakeholders, so a proactive, self-starting attitude is essential.


We believe you should also have:

* A university degree in Mechanical Engineering, Mechatronics, or a related field.
* Several years of solid experience in verification and testing methodologies for mechatronic components.
* Professional experience using mechanical measuring equipment.
* Experience in mechanical design and/or mechatronic systems; familiarity with CAD tools is a plus.
* Professional proficiency in English.

**Why should you join Elekta?**
===============================


In this role, you will work for a higher purpose: hope for everyone dealing with cancer and for everyone, regardless of where they are in the world, to have access to the best cancer care. Additionally, our benefit package includes:

* 30 paid vacation days/year, additional 4 Elekta days off /year (plus bank holidays).
* Attractive defined contribution pension scheme.
* Private Medical Insurance.
* Lunch Benefit.
* Contribution to wellness activities.
* Hybrid work option (you are required to work at the office or labs at least 3 days a week).

**Hiring process**
==================


We look forward to hearing from you! Please submit your application in English via the 'Apply' button. Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis. Please note that we the applications and the feedback can be handled only via the system.

#### **We are an equal opportunity employer**


We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

**About Elekta**
================


As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.


More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it's personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combine passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care. We don’t just build technology, we build hope.


Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with presence in more than 120 markets and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information about opportunities at Elekta, please visit elekta.com/company/careers.

title: Embedded firmware Consultant
description:
April 10, 2025
Full Time
Sweden
Posted 13 hours ago
We are hiring **Embedded firmware Consultant**for the position based in **Malmo, Sweden.**


**Educational Qualification:** Bachelor’s degreein Computer Engineering or a closely related field.


**Job Summary:**



We are looking for an experienced **Embedded Firmware Consultant** to join the development of a cutting-edge embedded software platform for connected (smart) digital locks. In this role, you will contribute to the full lifecycle of embedded software from hardware bring-up to implementing high-level communication protocols such as BLE and IP-based protocols. The work includes both low-level firmware tasks and integration of advanced features on custom hardware platforms.


**Required Experience/Competences:**


* **5-6+ years** of experience as an **Embedded Firmware Engineer.**
* Should have a strong background in **embedded software design and architecture.**
* Proficient in **embedded C** programming**.**
* Experience with **hardware** **bring-up** and working with **new chipsets.**
* Familiarity with **wireless protocols** like **BLE, Wi-Fi,** or **Thread** is meritorious.
* Experience with Nordic Semiconductor **BLE chipsets.**
* Prior experience with **Zephyr RTOS, FreeRTOS,** or similar real-time operating systems.
* Knowledge of communication protocols running on **IP or BLE.**


**Soft Skills:**


* Good communication skills and ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams
* Ability to troubleshoot complex embedded systems and find efficient, reliable solutions quickly.
* Proactively take responsibility for deliverables and deadlines, from bring-up to deployment.
### **Job Features**

title: Software Test Engineer
description:
Job Title
Software Test Engineer
Job Description*Are you a test engineer with great interest in technology and products? Are you curious about software solutions, including network and devices? Now you have the opportunity to work as team test engineer in the product area Video Management Systems (VMS) at Axis HQ in Lund.*
Who is your future team?  

You will work at ACS Pro Test, which is responsible for testing Axis' proprietary VMS Axis Camera Station Pro. This Windows product is an important part of Axis' end-to-end solutions for video surveillance. You can find more information here: https://www.axis.com/products/axis-camera-station-pro
With us, you are encouraged to dare to take on new challenges and contribute to us constantly improving. We want to be at the forefront of new ways of working and technologies and strive for a culture where everyone can be themselves, creative and innovative.
What you’ll do here as a Test Engineer for Axis Camera Station Pro?  

The development and testing of Axis Camera Station Pro is divided into many agile teams including both developers and testers. The team testing role we are about to fill is for a team that focuses on integration and support for video camera functionality in the VMS.
Some of the responsibilities are:* Plan and execute short term manual test needs based on new functionality together with the team
* Develop automated tests for the technical area
* Participate in release testing for the complete solution
* Lead the work to set up and maintain good test environments for both automated and manual testing covering the team’s needs
* Participate in improvement work in, for example, working methods, test strategy, automation and test environments


Who are we looking for?  

We are looking for you who have experience in software testing and have good knowledge of agile development methods. We believe that you have a master’s or bachelor’s degree in computer science or equivalent and have programming skills, preferably in Python and/or C#. You have previous experience of testing at different levels, manual and automated testing, functional and non-functional testing. You have experience of working with systems crossing the borders of software, hardware and network.
As a person, you are open, curious, structured and have a strong interest in technology. You cooperate and communicate smoothly with others in both Swedish and English, you take initiative, and you have a good eye for details.
What Axis have to offer  

With us, you get to work with colleagues with expertise from different parts of the organization, which is enriching and facilitates knowledge sharing. There are also great opportunities for personal growth and to develop in the direction you are interested in.
As a company, we expect a high level of commitment from our employees, but we also believe that a good balance between work and private life benefits both company and individuals.
Our corporate culture is essential – equal opportunities, team spirit and having fun! We want you to enjoy working with us and therefore we offer benefits such as flexible working hours, morning fika, Friday cake, bonus program, fitness allowance, health insurance and your very own Axis bike, to name a few.
Ready to act?  

Are you interested? We go through applications continuously so don’t wait to send in yours! If you have any questions, you are welcome to reach out to recruiting manager Pontus Nelderup at +46 46 272 1800.
Type of Employment
Permanent Employment
Posting End Date
2025-05-01*Certain roles at Axis require background checks, which means applicable verifications will be done in these recruitments.* *Notice will be provided before we take any action.*
About Axis Communications
We enable a smarter, safer world by creating innovative solutions for improving security and business performance. As a network technology company and industry leader, we offer solutions in video surveillance, access control, intercom, and audio systems, enhanced by intelligent analytics applications.
With around 5000 committed employees in over 50 countries, we collaborate with partners worldwide. Together, we thrive in our friendly, open, and collaborative culture and inspire each other to think beyond the expected. United by our commitment to inclusion, diversity, and sustainability, we consistently seek to develop our skills and way of working.
Let´s create a smarter, safer world
For more information about Axis, please visit our website www.axis.com.

title: Supply Chain Specialist - Quality Engineer
description:
The role shall be responsible for ensuring the consistent quality of raw materials, components, and sub-assemblies sourced from our external suppliers from a global supply base across Asia, Europe, Scandinavia and North America.


This critical role will be instrumental in safeguarding our manufacturing processes and the quality of our finished goods.


You will be responsible for establishing and maintaining robust quality standards throughout our supply chain, collaborating closely with suppliers to prevent defects, resolve manufacturing-related quality issues, and drive continuous improvement in their processes and performance**.**


Other responsibilities include:

* Develop and implement supplier quality assurance strategies and procedures specifically tailored to our manufacturing requirements and product specifications.
* Conduct thorough supplier evaluations and audits, focusing on their manufacturing capabilities, process controls, and adherence to our quality standards.
* Collaborate with sourcing and engineering teams to define precise quality requirements, including material specifications, dimensional tolerances, and performance criteria, for all purchased items used in our manufacturing processes.
* Review and approve supplier manufacturing process control plans, inspection plans, and quality documentation (e.g., PFMEA, control charts).
* Monitor supplier quality performance using relevant manufacturing KPIs (e.g., incoming inspection defect rates, supplier PPM, process capability). Analyze data to identify trends and implement proactive measures to prevent quality issues in our production lines.
* Lead the investigation and resolution of supplier-related quality issues impacting our manufacturing processes, including root cause analysis, containment actions, and the implementation of effective corrective and preventive actions (CAPA).
* Participate in the Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) process for new product introductions and engineering changes, ensuring supplier readiness for manufacturing and adherence to quality requirements from the outset.
* Conduct First Article Inspections (FAI) and validate supplier manufacturing processes to ensure they meet our specifications and quality standards before full-scale production.

**Requirements**

* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering (Manufacturing, Mechanical, Industrial, or related field) or a relevant technical discipline with a strong understanding of manufacturing processes.
* 5 – 10 years of proven experience in a similar role within a manufacturing environment.
* In-depth knowledge of quality management systems (e.g., ISO 9001, IATF 16949, AS9100 depending on the industry) and their application in a manufacturing setting.
* Strong understanding and practical application of core quality tools relevant to manufacturing (e.g., APQP, PPAP, FMEA, SPC, MSA, 8D problem-solving).
* Demonstrated experience in conducting supplier audits focused on manufacturing processes and quality controls.
* Proven ability to analyze manufacturing quality data, identify root causes of defects, and implement effective corrective and preventive actions in a production environment.
* Excellent communication, interpersonal, and negotiation skills to collaborate effectively with suppliers and internal manufacturing teams.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on improving manufacturing quality and efficiency.
* Ability to interpret technical drawings, specifications, and manufacturing process documentation.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint).
* Experience in medium-volume agile made-to-order manufacturing operations; precision machining; electronics assembly; EMS industry preferred
* CQE, CQA, Lean Six Sigma Green Belt/Black Belt preferred
* Fluency in English is essential.
* Experience with statistical process control (SPC) software and its application in manufacturing.
* Knowledge of lean manufacturing principles and their impact on supplier quality.

title: Field Service Engineer to Oxford Instruments
description:
Join our team as a Field Service Engineer in a permanent role based in Sweden! The role is field-based and will mainly cover Sweden, Denmark, Finland and Norway. In this exciting position, you will be responsible for installing and upgrading systems and software at customer locations, ensuring that OIPT equipment is fully operational and ready for use. With regular extensive travel in the Nordic region and occasionally the EMEA area, this role offers the perfect opportunity for those who enjoy dynamic work environments and making a direct impact on customer satisfaction. Don't miss your chance to be part of our innovative team!
  
We evaluate candidates continuously and welcome your application today!
  
ROLE DESCRIPTION
  
As a Field Service Engineer, your Key Responsibilities would be:
  
* Carry out the commissioning of equipment including any operational and maintenance training requirements
* Respond to emergency breakdowns for any warranty and service contract work.
* Report regularly to the EMEA Team Leader on all relevant issues and for PDR objectives.
* Provide a visit report for each customer visit, detailing work completed, outstanding issues, time spent on site, travelling etc., and help to ensure that all chargeable work is invoiced to the customer promptly.
* Authorise system ‘buy-off’ prior to shipment either with or in the absence of the customer.
* Liaise with technical support and systems engineering on any potential or actual system problems.
* Liaise with Sales Team to provide useful background information.
* Help to maintain an accurate record of the status of systems, timing of warranty, parts supplied and service contracts.
* Keep up to date all relevant enquiries and project files on any significant information.
* Provide detailed and accurate record of expense incurred on behalf of the Company.


YOUR PROFILE
  
* Formal electrical/electronic/ mechatronic qualification (e.g. qualified electrician).
* Working experience and relevant training as a Field Service Engineer or Customer Service.
* Ability to interpret Electrical and Mechanical drawings. Ability to trace signals and components using Electrical schematic diagrams.
* Experience of 3 phase HV (415 - 440 V) and LV electrical commissioning and fault finding.
* Good PC / PLC experience preferred.
* Experience of Semi-Conductor or closely related high-Tech electronic industry is a plus.
* Fluent English speaker and good knowledge in Swedish. Another European language would be a plus.
* Driving licence.
* Willingness to travel up to 90%.
* Able to work on own initiative.
* Clear & concise communicator.
* Able to prioritise multiple tasks.


**We offer:**  

* Company car
* Language Courses
* Flexible working hours
* Fantastic team and supportive culture
* Development programmes
* Home office
* 30 days paid leave
* Great team events


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or disability.
  
ABOUT OXFORD INSTRUMENTS
  
At Oxford Instruments, we enable the world’s leading industrial companies and scientific research communities to image, analyse and manipulate materials down to the atomic and molecular level. With a sixty-year history, and fourteen Queen’s Awards for Enterprise, our world-class products and technologies are helping our customers to address the greatest challenges of the 21st century.
  
Plasma Technology, as a part of Oxford Instruments Group, offers flexible, configurable process tools and leading-edge processes for the precise, controllable and repeatable engineering of micro- and nanostructures. Our systems provide process solutions for the etching of nanometre sized features, nanolayer deposition and the controlled growth of nanostructures. These solutions are based on core technologies in plasma-enhanced deposition and etch, ion-beam deposition and etch, atomic layer deposition, deep silicon etch and physical vapour deposition.
  
**To learn more, please visit:** https://www.oxinst.com/

title: Functional Safety Engineer
description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth, we are now recruiting for a Functional Safety Engineer to strengthen our team in Gothenburg.
  
THE ROLE
  
This role is for supporting the Inhouse software development of Battery Management system's Basic Software
  
  

**AREA OF RESPONSIBILITY:**  

* Take part in developing and maintaining the Project Safety Plan
* Review Technical Safety Requirement and Support in Deriving the SW safety requirements to Autosar BSW.
* Responsible to Create & Maintain the Software Verification Strategy for BSW.
* Lead the Software safety analysis (FTA /FMEA) and provide feedback to the relevant stakeholders.
* Track all the Safety activities/Artefacts to closure as per ISO26262-Part6.
* Review of Safety Work products related to BSW.
* Create/Update BSW Safety case and release for production.
* Be the point of contact for All the safety related activities.


**EXPERIENCE / KNOWLEGDE:**  

* Masters/ bachelor’s degree in computer science/electronics/electrical engineering
* Proven prior work experience in Functional safety engineering. (Experience in ISO26262- Part6 is a plus.)
* Experience in the multicore Autosar architecture-based SW development.
* Good understanding of the SW testing methodologies-
* Experience & understanding of product development cycle in Automotive.
* Experience in BSW/Electric Propulsion domain is a plus.
* Should be able to guide the team with respect to Functional safety process and work products.
* Ability to independently Put together a plan, conduct and follow-up towards the work objective.
* Good Communication skills (English Spoken and written) & team Player skills.


If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on and want to join a global company, then this is the place for you.
  
**Tata Technologies:** Engineering a better world.
  
Tata Technologies would like to thank all applicants for their interest, each application will be reviewed against the set criteria for the role. We would like to advise that only candidates under consideration will be contacted. If you do not hear from us within 10 working days following the closing date it will mean that unfortunately your application has not been successful. We will however retain your details for any suitable future opportunities.

title: Development Engineer
description:

title: Development Engineer
description:
Volvo Penta is currently seeking a talented Engine Development Engineer to join our team.

  

We believe that you have a genuine interest of working with testing and optimization of internal combustion engines and we expect that you have both the knowledge of fundamental combustion theory, engine controls and experience of developing combustion engines.

**About us**
------------


Industrial Development and Calibration within product development is responsible for testing and optimization of both hardware and software regarding performance, emissions and durability of all our industrial combustion engines.

  

As a Development Engineer, you will be accountable for delivering test and optimization tasks. You will be a part of a project team within the Industrial Development and Calibration team. The work is mainly conducted at the Volvo Penta Lundby test facilities but sometimes travels are needed to support customers or projects at other locations.

**Main tasks and responsibilities**
-----------------------------------


In this role, you will work with various tasks within engine testing like test object preparation, performance testing or advanced software calibration of engine and aftertreatment systems. You need abilities to understand control systems by reading functional descriptions and using tools such as AVL Concerto, ATI Vision, Python and internal development tools.

  

Collaboration is essential in this position, as you will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of engine systems while providing technical support and expertise throughout the product development lifecycle. Additionally, you will prepare detailed reports on engine performance findings, calibration adjustments, and validation results, presenting your findings to stakeholders and contributing to continuous improvement initiatives.

**Requirements**
----------------

* Master of Science or similar relevant technical experience
* Several years of experience in combustion engine development
* Engine calibration experience
* Fluent in English, written and spoken
* Driver license for car
**What we can offer**
---------------------

* A supportive team atmosphere that encourages open communication and collaboration.
* Opportunities for personal and professional growth through shared learning experiences.
* A chance to contribute to exciting projects and make a real impact.

  

If you are enthusiastic about working in a team that prioritizes support and continuous learning, we want to hear from you! Join us and help shape the future together. **Apply Now!**

 **For further information, please contact:**


Katarina Törnberg, Manager Industrial Dev. & Calibration, katarina.tornberg@volvo.com

  

Last application date: April 27

  

We value your data privacy and therefore do not accept applications via mail.

 **Who we are and what we believe in**  

Our focus on Inclusion, Diversity, and Equity allows each of us the opportunity to bring our full authentic self to work and thrive by providing a safe and supportive environment, free of harassment and discrimination. We are committed to removing the barriers to entry, which is why we ask that even if you feel you may not meet every qualification on the job description, please apply and let us decide.

  

Applying to this job offers you the opportunity to join **Volvo Group**. Every day, across the globe, our trucks, buses, engines, construction equipment, financial services, and solutions make modern life possible. We are almost 100,000 people empowered to shape the future landscape of efficient, safe and sustainable transport solutions. Fulfilling our mission creates countless career opportunities for talents with sharp minds and passion across the group’s leading brands and entities.

 **Volvo Penta**, a world-leading supplier of engines and complete drive systems for marine and industrial applications, you will be part of a global and diverse team of highly skilled professionals who works with passion, trust each other and embraces change to stay ahead. We make our customers win.

title: R&D Engineer for System Design
description:
**Location:**

Ludvika, Dalarna County, Sweden
**Job ID:**

R0062098
**Date Posted:**

2024-11-15
**Company Name:**

HITACHI ENERGY SWEDEN AB
**Profession (Job Category):**

Engineering & Science
**Job Schedule:**

Full time
**Remote:**

No
**Job Description:**

**The opportunity**

Are you interested in being part of a team that influences the future of power systems and grids? We are looking for multiple candidates with diverse backgrounds and experiences to strengthen our growing team.


In our R&D department, you will have the opportunity to delve into technical areas such as system design, control and protection, main circuit design, insulation coordination, harmonic studies, dynamic performance studies, transient studies, MMC control, and power electronics. This includes working on various HVDC (VSC and LCC) solutions, including multiterminal solutions.


As an R&D Engineer, you will be part of the Technology & Solutions Development (Business R&D) organization in HVDC at Hitachi Energy. You will collaborate with a diverse group of talented engineers from around the world, as we are part of a global team with offices in Sweden, India, and Germany.


If this sounds interesting to you, please send in your application! You could be one of our new team members on our journey to advancing a sustainable energy future for all.


**How you will make an impact**

* The R&D tasks will include one or more areas within the design of HVDC VSC and LCC converter topologies, control and protection, main circuit design, insulation coordination, steady-state and dynamic stability analysis, harmonic analysis, and performance under various network conditions
* Meet the constantly evolving requirements from customers, keeping both internal and external stakeholders in focus
* Uphold Hitachi Energy’s core values of safety and integrity by taking responsibility for actions and showing care for colleagues and the business
* Be a true team player, contributing to a supportive group that already collaborates effectively
* Enjoy working in an agile and hands-on manner, ready to take ownership of both the technology being worked with and personal development
* We offer an exciting role in an international environment with great opportunities for further development within Hitachi Energy

**Your background**

* A Master of Science or PhD is preferred, with a major in Power Systems, Power Electronics, Electrical Machines and Drives, Control Systems, Sustainable Energy, Engineering Physics, or equivalent
* A few years of work experience is preferred within HVDC or FACTS technology, but recent graduates are also encouraged to apply
* Experience with software such as MATLAB, PSCAD/EMTDC, or similar is valuable. Previous experience in Modelica (Dymola/Open Modelica), C/C++, and Python is also a significant advantage
* We seek open-minded individuals who are receptive to diverse ideas and can collaborate to find innovative solutions to industrial challenges
* Candidates should be analytical, organized, and eager to develop the latest technology. A natural problem solver who enjoys tackling new challenges is ideal. Basic project management experience in planning and coordinating tasks is a plus
* As part of a company operating on a global scale, proficiency in English is required

**What we offer**

* Collective agreement
* Flexible working time
* Health care and wellness allowance
* Fantastic career possibilities within Hitachi Energy both within Sweden and globally
* Mentor to support you throughout onboard phase
* Various trainings and education supporting employee development
* Diversified company with over 70+ nationalities working in Sweden
* Supplementary compensation for parental leave
* Employee Benefit Portal with thousands of discounts and perks

**More about us**

Are you ready to join Hitachi Energy for a career with no limits and a place where you can be yourself? We are ready for you! Welcome to apply for this position!
